73 struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer
74 {
75  struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pNext; // singly linked list [for now]
76  // NOTE: a background process can trim this to a reasonable size
77 
78  // NOTE: for a simple row/col insert or paste, left=right, top=bottom
79  // for all other operations, the rctSel will apply accordingly
80  WB_RECT rctSelOld; // original select rectangle (as applicable)
81  WB_RECT rctSelNew; // new select rectangle after the operation
82 
83  int iOperation; // select=0, delete=1, insert/paste=2, replace=3
84  int iSelMode; // selection mode
85 
86  int nOld; // size of 'old' buffer (zero if none)
87  int nNew; // size of 'new' buffer (zero if none)
88 
89  char aData[2]; // actual data for operation
90 };

266 // line endings translated from 'enum' to 'const char *'

268 static __inline__ const char * __internal_get_line_ending_text(enum _LineFeed_ iIndex)
269 {
270  static const char * const szLineEndings[LineFeed_ENTRYCOUNT] =
271  {
272 #ifdef WIN32
273  "\r\n"
274 #else // POSIX
275  "\n",
276 #endif // OS-dependent line endings
277  "\n","\r","\r\n","\n\r"
278  };
279 
280  if((int)iIndex < 0 || (int)iIndex >= LineFeed_ENTRYCOUNT)
281  {
282  return NULL; // single-line or invalid
283  }
284  return szLineEndings[iIndex];
285 }

295 // TODO: an API function for single-line text
296 
297 #define DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES 16384
298 
299 TEXT_BUFFER * WBAllocTextBuffer(const char *pBuf, unsigned int cbBufSize)
300 {
301 TEXT_BUFFER *pRval;
302 int nLines = 0;
303 int cbLen;
304 
305  if(pBuf && (cbBufSize || *pBuf))
306  {
307  nLines = WBStringLineCount(pBuf, cbBufSize);
308 
309  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d allocate for %d lines\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, nLines);
310  }
311 
312  if(nLines < DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES)
313  {
314  nLines = DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES;
315  }
316 
317  cbLen = sizeof(*pRval) + nLines * sizeof(pRval->aLines[0]);
318  pRval = WBAlloc(cbLen);
319 
320  if(!pRval)
321  {
322  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - not enough memory (%ld)\n", __FUNCTION__,
323  (unsigned long)(sizeof(*pRval) + nLines * sizeof(pRval->aLines[0])));
324  return NULL;
325  }
326 
327  memset(pRval, 0, cbLen); // zero out entire structure (always)
328 
329  pRval->nArraySize = nLines; // pre-assigned values
330 // pRval->nEntries = 0; already zero, comment left for reference
331 
332  if(pBuf && (cbBufSize || *pBuf))
333  {
334  int nL = 0;
335  const char *p1;
336 
337  if(!cbBufSize)
338  {
339  cbBufSize = strlen(pBuf);
340  }
341 
342  do
343  {
344  int cbLen;
345  char *p2, *p3;
346 
347  cbLen = cbBufSize; // size before I begin
348  p1 = WBStringNextLine(pBuf, &cbBufSize);
349 
350  if(p1) // another line remains
351  {
352  cbLen = p1 - pBuf; // re-calc length based on new pointer
353  }
354 
355  p2 = WBAlloc(cbLen + 2);
356 
357  if(!p2)
358  {
359  WBFreeTextBuffer(pRval);
360  pRval = NULL;
361  break;
362  }
363 
364  if(cbLen) // it's possible it may be zero
365  {
366  memcpy(p2, pBuf, cbLen); // copy the data
367  }
368 
369  p3 = p2 + cbLen; // the end of the string
370  *p3 = 0; // always zero-byte terminate it first
371 
372  while(p3 > p2 && (*(p3 - 1) <= ' ' ||
373  *(p3 - 1) == HARD_TAB_CHAR)) // trim ALL trailing white space including CR, LF, tab, space, FF, etc.
374  {
375  // TODO: handle <FF> or <VT> differently?
376  // TODO: leave white space to mark 'extent' of line? naaw, probably not
377 
378  *(--p3) = 0; // for now just trim it all (p3 always points past end of string)
379  }
380 
381  pRval->aLines[nL++] = p2;
382 
383 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - %4d: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, nL, p2);
384 
385  pBuf = p1;
386 
387  } while(pBuf && cbBufSize && nL < nLines);
388 
389  pRval->nEntries = nL; // NOTE: on error, this will be needed for cleanup
390 
391 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s - %ld lines\n", __FUNCTION__, pRval->nEntries);
392 
393  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pRval);
394  }
395 
396 // if(pRval)
397 // {
398 // int nL;
399 //
400 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("\nTEMPORARY - %s - %ld lines\n", __FUNCTION__, pRval->nEntries);
401 //
402 // for(nL=0; nL < pRval->nEntries; nL++)
403 // {
404 // WB_ERROR_PRINT(" \"%s\"\n", pRval->aLines[nL]);
405 // }
406 //
407 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("END TEMPORARY - %s\n\n", __FUNCTION__);
408 // }
409 
410 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY - %s returns %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pRval);
411 
412  return pRval;
413 }
414 
415 int WBCheckReAllocTextBuffer(TEXT_BUFFER **ppBuf, int nLinesToAdd)
416 {
417 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
418 int nNew;
419 
420  if(!ppBuf || !*ppBuf)
421  {
422  return -1; // error
423  }
424 
425  // TODO: parameter validation
426 
427  pBuf = *ppBuf;
428 
429  nNew = pBuf->nEntries + nLinesToAdd;
430 
431  if(nNew > pBuf->nArraySize)
432  {
433  nNew += DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES;
434  nNew -= (nNew % (DEFAULT_TEXT_BUFFER_LINES / 2));
435 
436  pBuf = WBReAlloc(pBuf, sizeof(*pBuf) + nNew * sizeof(pBuf->aLines[0]));
437 
438  if(!pBuf)
439  {
440  return -1; // error
441  }
442 
443  pBuf->nArraySize = nNew;
444  *ppBuf = pBuf; // potentially new pointer - probably is, though
445  }
446 
447  return 0; // no problems
448 }
449 
450 void WBFreeTextBuffer(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf)
451 {
452 int i1;
453 
454  if(!pBuf)
455  {
456  return;
457  }
458 
459  // TODO: parameter validation
460 
461  for(i1=0; i1 < pBuf->nEntries && i1 < pBuf->nArraySize; i1++)
462  {
463  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
464  {
465  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
466  pBuf->aLines[i1] = NULL; // by convention
467  }
468  }
469 
470  WBFree(pBuf);
471 }
472 
473 int WBTextBufferLineLength(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf, unsigned long nLine)
474 {
475 int i1;
476 
477  if(!pBuf || pBuf->nEntries <= nLine) // not enough lines in buffer?
478  {
479  return 0;
480  }
481 
482  // TODO: hashing, sorted, ?
483 
484  for(i1=0; i1 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1]; i1++)
485  {
486  if(pBuf->aLineCache[i1] == nLine)
487  {
488  return pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1];
489  }
490  }
491 
492  return 0;
493 }
494 
495 void WBTextBufferLineChange(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf, unsigned long nLine, int nNewLen)
496 {
497 int i1, i2;
498 unsigned int nNewMax = 0, nNewMinMax = UINT_MAX;
499 
500 
501  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 1) // zero or one lines?
502  {
503  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - (single line) nLine=%ld, nNewLen = %d\n",
504  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, nLine, nNewLen);
505 
506  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf); // always do it THIS way
507 
508  return;
509  }
510 
511  if(nLine > pBuf->nEntries) // line number isn't sane?
512  {
513  return; // sanity check failed (do nothing)
514  }
515 
516  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - nLine=%ld, nNewLen = %d\n",
517  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, nLine, nNewLen);
518 
519  // update the line info in my cache. If this line appears, remove it (always).
520  // If I'm deleting the line, subtract one from every line higher than this one.
521 
522  i1 = 0;
523 
524  while(i1 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1])
525  {
526  if(pBuf->aLineCache[i1] == nLine)
527  {
528  // move everything up, remove the last entry
529  for(i2=i1 + 1; i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2]; i2++)
530  {
531  pBuf->aLineCache[i2 - 1] = pBuf->aLineCache[i2];
532  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2 - 1] = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2];
533  }
534 
535  // at this point 'i2 - 1' _was_ the last entry. make sure it has zeros in it.
536  i2--;
537  if(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE)
538  {
539  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = 0;
540  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = 0;
541  }
542  }
543  else // if it's a line that follows this one, make sure I decrement the line number if I deleted it
544  {
545  if(pBuf->aLineCache[i1] > nLine)
546  {
547  if(nNewLen < 0) // a line deletion
548  {
549  pBuf->aLineCache[i1] --; // line was removed, so new line count must match
550  }
551  }
552 
553  if(nNewMax < pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1])
554  {
555  nNewMax = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1]; // done this way as sanity check
556  }
557 
558  if(nNewMinMax > pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1])
559  {
560  nNewMinMax = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1]; // done this way as sanity check
561  }
562 
563  i1++;
564  }
565  }
566 
567  // if the cache is NOW empty, re-evaluate it.
568  if(!pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0]) // empty
569  {
570  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit (d) after WBTextBufferRefreshCache()\n", __FUNCTION__);
571 
572  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf);
573  return;
574  }
575 
576  // I've re-evaluated the max and min-max from the cache, so use that info
577 
578  pBuf->nMaxCol = nNewMax;
579 
580  if(nNewMinMax <= nNewMax) // NOTE: if cache is empty, nNewMinMax will be UINT_MAX
581  {
582  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = nNewMinMax; // sanity checked value
583  }
584  else
585  {
586  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = nNewMax; // don't put insane values in there (just in case)
587  // TODO: consider refactoring this code out once the algorithm is proved to work
588  }
589 
590  if(nNewLen < 0) // a line deletion
591  {
592  if(!nNewMax) // in case my cache has dwindled to nothing
593  {
594  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit (c) after WBTextBufferRefreshCache()\n", __FUNCTION__);
595 
596  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf); // time to re-evaluate
597  }
598  else
599  {
600  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit (c)\n", __FUNCTION__);
601  }
602 
603  return; // I'm done for delete. The rest is for updates
604  }
605 
606  // see if the length exceeds any of the maximums, and do an 'insertion sort'
607  // into my cache array if it does. Otherwise I can just leave.
608 
609  if(!nNewLen) // don't bother, it has a zero length
610  {
611  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit (f)\n", __FUNCTION__);
612 
613  return; // I'm done - no need to re-insert this line into the cache (yet)
614  }
615 
616  if(nNewLen >= pBuf->nMaxCol) // bigger than maximum (or equal to it)
617  {
618  i2 = 0; // my insert point
619 
620  pBuf->nMaxCol = nNewLen; // new 'max'
621  if(nNewLen < nNewMinMax) // sanity test for empty cache
622  {
623  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = nNewLen; // may happen, if new cache is totally empty
624  }
625  }
626  else if(nNewLen >= pBuf->nMinMaxCol) // between min max and max
627  {
628  // find the place to insert this line into the cache
629  i2 = 0; // NOTE: platform-independent loop structure, probably not necessary, but...
630  while(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2])
631  {
632  if(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] < nNewLen) // the insert point
633  {
634  break;
635  }
636 
637  i2++; // don't forget this or infinite loop will result, heh
638  }
639  }
640  else
641  {
642  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit (a)\n", __FUNCTION__);
643 
644  return; // I'm done - no need to re-insert this line into the cache (yet)
645  // NOTE: re-inserting the line into the cache would require re-doing the
646  // cache information from scratch. this is an optimization, so I'll
647  // avoid THAT operation until it's truly necessary.
648  }
649 
650  // at this point, 'i2' is the insertion point for the line length info
651 
652  if(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE) // sanity check, might happen
653  {
654  // insert at 'i2'
655  for(i1=TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE - 1; i1 > i2; i1--)
656  {
657  pBuf->aLineCache[i1] = pBuf->aLineCache[i1 - 1];
658  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1] = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i1 - 1];
659  }
660 
661  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = nLine;
662  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = nNewLen;
663  }
664 
665  // everything should be ok now, unless I b0rked something
666 
667  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit (b)\n", __FUNCTION__);
668 }
669 
670 void WBTextBufferRefreshCache(TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf)
671 {
672 int iLine, i1, i2, i3;
673 char *p1;
674 
675  if(!pBuf)
676  {
677  return;
678  }
679 
680  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s\n", __FUNCTION__);
681 
682  // zero out the cache arrays
683  memset(pBuf->aLineCache, 0, sizeof(pBuf->aLineCache));
684  memset(pBuf->aLineCacheLen, 0, sizeof(pBuf->aLineCacheLen));
685 
686  pBuf->nMaxCol = pBuf->nMinMaxCol = 0; // initialize to zero
687 
688  if(!pBuf->nEntries)
689  {
690  return;
691  }
692  else if(pBuf->nEntries == 1)
693  {
694  if(pBuf->aLines[0])
695  {
696  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0] = // refactored, do this assignment here instead
697  pBuf->nMaxCol = pBuf->nMinMaxCol = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[0]); // assign length to 'max' and 'minmax'
698 // if(pBuf->nMaxCol) 'refactored out' (left to document process, remove later)
699 // {
700 // pBuf->aLineCache[0] = 0; this value already assigned by 'memset'
701 // pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0] = pBuf->nMaxCol; refactored code does this
702 // }
703  }
704 
705  return;
706  }
707 
708  // the big loop
709 
710  for(iLine=0; iLine < pBuf->nEntries; iLine++)
711  {
712  // do not consider blank lines or lines with zero length
713  p1 = pBuf->aLines[iLine];
714 
715  if(!p1)
716  {
717  continue;
718  }
719 
720  i1 = WBGetMBLength(p1);
721 
722  if(!i1)
723  {
724  continue;
725  }
726 
727  if(i1 > pBuf->nMinMaxCol) // assume data is consistent
728  {
729  // perform an insertion sort into 'aLineCache'
730 
731  // step 1: find the insertion point
732 
733  i2 = 0; // NOTE: platform-independent loop structure, probably not necessary, but...
734  while(i2 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2])
735  {
736  if(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] < i1) // the insert point
737  {
738  break;
739  }
740 
741  i2++; // don't forget this or infinite loop will result, heh
742  }
743 
744  if(i2 >= TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE) // logic fail, clean it up
745  {
746  pBuf->nMaxCol = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0]; // forced re-evaluation
747  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE - 1];
748  }
749  else if(i2 == TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE - 1)
750  {
751  // special case, insert at the end
752  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = iLine;
753  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = i1;
754 
755  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = i1; // the new 'min max'
756  }
757  else
758  {
759  // if this is the first line in the cache, update 'nMaxCol'
760  if(!i2) // NOTE: this test is done here 'cause of likely register optimization
761  {
762  pBuf->nMaxCol = i1;
763  }
764 
765  i3 = i2 + 1;
766  while(i3 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE && pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i3])
767  {
768  i3++; // finding the end
769  }
770 
771  // move everything down using 'memmove'
772 
773  memmove(&(pBuf->aLineCache[i2 + 1]), &(pBuf->aLineCache[i2]),
774  (i3 - i2 - 1) * sizeof(pBuf->aLineCache[0]));
775  memmove(&(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2 + 1]), &(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2]),
776  (i3 - i2 - 1) * sizeof(pBuf->aLineCacheLen[0]));
777 
778  // use the final line's index and re-assign the 'max' and 'min max'
779  pBuf->nMinMaxCol = pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i3 - 1];
780 
781  // make sure the last element(s) have a zero length (TODO: optimize?)
782  while(i3 < TEXT_BUFFER_LINE_CACHE_SIZE)
783  {
784  pBuf->aLineCache[i3] = 0; // do this to, just because
785  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i3] = 0;
786 
787  i3++;
788  }
789 
790  // and finally, insert this line's info at position 'i2'
791 
792  pBuf->aLineCache[i2] = iLine;
793  pBuf->aLineCacheLen[i2] = i1;
794  }
795  }
796  }
797 
798  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s exit point\n", __FUNCTION__);
799 }

837 int WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(int iAscent, int iDescent) // consistently calculate line height from font ascent/descent
838 {
839 int iFontHeight;
840 
841  iFontHeight = iAscent + iDescent;
842 
843  // adjust font height to include line spacing (I'll use this to position the lines)
844  if(iDescent > MIN_LINE_SPACING / 2)
845  {
846  iFontHeight += iDescent / 2; // line spacing is 1/2 of descent, or MIN_LINE_SPACING
847  }
848  else
849  {
850  iFontHeight += MIN_LINE_SPACING;
851  }
852 
853  return iFontHeight;
854 }

883 static void __internal_free_undo_redo_buffer(void *pBuffer)
884 {
885  if(pBuffer)
886  {
887  // TODO: validate that it's an undo/redo buffer
888 
889  struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pU = (struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *)pBuffer;
890 
891  do
892  {
893  struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pUsa = pU;
894 
895  pU = pU->pNext;
896  WBFree(pUsa); // for now just do this
897 
898  } while(pU);
899  }
900 }
901 
902 #define UNDO_LIMIT 256
903 
904 // NULL 'prctStartSel' or 'prctEndSel' implies 'NONE' selected, i.e. {0,0,0,0}
905 static void __internal_add_undo(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iOperation, int iSelMode,
906  int iStartRow, int iStartCol, const WB_RECT *prctStartSel,
907  const char *pStartText, int cbStartText,
908  int iEndRow, int iEndCol, const WB_RECT *prctEndSel,
909  const char *pEndText, int cbEndText)
910 {
911 int cbLen, cbLen2, i1;
912 struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *pUndo, *pTU, *pTU2;
913 
914 
915  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
916  {
917  return;
918  }
919 
920  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
921 
922  cbLen = cbLen2 = 0;
923 
924  if(pStartText)
925  {
926  if(cbStartText < 0)
927  {
928  cbStartText = strlen(pStartText); // TODO: WBGetMBLength ?
929  }
930 
931  if(cbStartText > 0)
932  {
933  cbLen += cbStartText;
934  }
935  }
936 
937  if(pEndText)
938  {
939  if(cbEndText < 0)
940  {
941  cbEndText = strlen(pEndText); // TODO: WBGetMBLength?
942  }
943 
944  if(cbEndText > 0)
945  {
946  cbLen2 += cbEndText;
947  }
948  }
949 
950  pUndo = (struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *)WBAlloc(cbLen + cbLen2 + 4 + sizeof(*pUndo));
951  if(!pUndo)
952  {
953  // TODO: walk the 'undo' chain and start removing stuff, and retry the alloc
954 
955  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - unable to create undo buffer, errno=%d\n", __FUNCTION__, errno);
956  return;
957  }
958 
959  pUndo->iOperation = iOperation;
960  pUndo->iSelMode = iSelMode;
961 
962  if(prctStartSel)
963  {
964  memcpy(&(pUndo->rctSelOld), prctStartSel, sizeof(WB_RECT));
965  }
966  else
967  {
968  memset(&(pUndo->rctSelOld), 0, sizeof(WB_RECT));
969  }
970 
971  if(prctEndSel)
972  {
973  memcpy(&(pUndo->rctSelNew), prctEndSel, sizeof(WB_RECT));
974  }
975  else
976  {
977  memset(&(pUndo->rctSelNew), 0, sizeof(WB_RECT));
978  }
979 
980  // this code should work on multi-byte characters as well...
981 
982  pUndo->nOld = cbLen;
983  if(cbLen)
984  {
985  memcpy(pUndo->aData, pStartText, cbLen);
986  pUndo->aData[cbLen++] = 0; // just because
987  }
988 
989  pUndo->nOld = cbLen;
990 
991  if(cbLen2)
992  {
993  memcpy(pUndo->aData + cbLen, pEndText, cbLen2);
994  pUndo->aData[cbLen + cbLen2++] = 0; // just because
995  }
996 
997  pUndo->nNew = cbLen2;
998 
999  // insert undo buffer into the 'chain'
1000 
1001  pTU = pUndo->pNext = (struct __internal_undo_redo_buffer *)(pThis->pUndo);
1002  pThis->pUndo = pUndo;
1003 
1004  // NOW walk the chain and remove things past a certain point. For now, UNDO_LIMIT
1005  // NOTE: this is a compromise - the alternative is a double-link list and an 'end' pointer
1006  // along with a running count of items. If the number of undo/redo items becomes
1007  // VERY large, that might be a better alternative. So for now I use a single-link list.
1008 
1009  if(pTU)
1010  {
1011  for(i1=1; i1 < UNDO_LIMIT && pTU->pNext; pTU = pTU->pNext, i1++) { }
1012  // on a modern CPU, this shouldn't take more than a few microseconds
1013 
1014  if(pTU->pNext) // will only be true if I have too many entries
1015  {
1016  // free and unhook the chain
1017  pTU2 = pTU->pNext;
1018  pTU->pNext = NULL; // generally safer THIS way
1019 
1020  __internal_free_undo_redo_buffer(pTU2); // NOW free what was once chained from here
1021  }
1022  }
1023 
1024  // whenever I add an 'undo' HERE, I screw up the 'redo' so blast it away if it exists
1025  if(pThis->pRedo)
1026  {
1027  pTU = pThis->pRedo;
1028  pThis->pRedo = NULL;
1029 
1030  __internal_free_undo_redo_buffer(pTU);
1031  }
1032 }

1204 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1205 // __internal_get_selected_text - arbitrary text retrieval (internal only)
1206 // returns WBAlloc'd string pointer
1207 //
1208 // iRow is the starting row position
1209 // iCol is the starting column position
1210 // iEndRow is the ending row position. In modes OTHER than 'box mode', this may equal 'iCol'
1211 // iEndCol is the ending column position. In modes OTHER than 'box mode' this may be LESS than 'iCol'
1212 static char * __internal_get_selected_text(const struct _text_object_ *pThis,
1213  int iRow, int iCol, int iEndRow, int iEndCol)
1214 {
1215 int i1, i2, i3, cb1, cbLF=0;
1216 char *p1, *pRval = NULL;
1217 const char *szLineFeed = NULL;
1218 TEXT_BUFFER *pTB;
1219 int iIsBoxMode, iIsLineMode;
1220 
1221 
1222  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "calling %s(%d,%d,%d,%d)\n", __FUNCTION__, iRow, iCol, iEndRow, iEndCol);
1223 
1224  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1225  {
1226  if(!pThis->pText)
1227  {
1228  return WBCopyString(""); // return a blank string
1229  }
1230 
1231  if(iRow < 0)
1232  {
1233  iRow = 0;
1234  }
1235  if(iCol < 0)
1236  {
1237  iCol = 0;
1238  }
1239  if(iEndRow < 0)
1240  {
1241  iEndRow = INT_MAX;
1242  }
1243  if(iEndCol < 0)
1244  {
1245  iEndCol = INT_MAX;
1246  }
1247 
1248  if(iRow == iEndRow)
1249  {
1250  iIsBoxMode = iIsLineMode = 0;
1251  }
1252  else
1253  {
1254  if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_BOX)
1255  {
1256  iIsBoxMode = 1;
1257  iIsLineMode = 0;
1258  }
1259  else if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_LINE)
1260  {
1261  iIsBoxMode = 0;
1262  iIsLineMode = 1;
1263  }
1264  else // char and default
1265  {
1266  iIsBoxMode = 0;
1267  iIsLineMode = 0;
1268  }
1269  }
1270 
1271  if(iRow > iEndRow // row exceeds ending row
1272  || (iRow == iEndRow && iCol >= iEndCol) // single row with no 'width'
1273  /* || (box mode && iCol >= iEndCol) */) // box mode requires iCol < iEndCol
1274  {
1275  return WBCopyString(""); // return a blank string
1276  }
1277 
1278  pTB = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
1279 
1280  // NOTE: when iRow == iEndRow, both box mode and line mode revert to 'stream mode'
1281  // and the 'iIsBoxMode' and 'iIsStreamMode' flags will both be zero
1282 
1283  if(iIsBoxMode)
1284  {
1285  cb1 = (iEndRow - iRow + 1) * (2 + iEndCol - iCol);
1286  }
1287  else
1288  {
1289  // FOR NOW just go through the TEXT_BUFFER array, determine the length (later cache it)
1290 
1291  for(i1=iRow, cb1=4; i1 < pTB->nEntries && i1 <= iEndRow; i1++)
1292  {
1293  i2 = strlen(pTB->aLines[i1]); // use 'strlen' here, as I want the REAL length
1294 
1295  // last line in 'normal' select mode limits width - 'iEndCol' may be 0
1296  if(i1 == iEndRow // i.e. "the last line" in the selected area
1297  && !iIsLineMode) // NOT 'line mode' (will be always false for single-row selects)
1298  {
1299  if(i2 > iEndCol) // trim the indicated length of the line accordingly
1300  {
1301  i2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTB->aLines[i1], iEndCol, NULL) - pTB->aLines[i1];
1302  }
1303  }
1304 
1305  cb1 += i2 + 2; // do this regardless (it's only to count up max string length)
1306  }
1307  }
1308 
1309  // now build the string using the specified line ending and selection mode
1310 
1311  szLineFeed = __internal_get_line_ending_text(pThis->iLineFeed);
1312 
1313  if(!szLineFeed) // single-line
1314  {
1315  if(pTB->nEntries > 1)
1316  {
1317  szLineFeed = __internal_get_line_ending_text(LineFeed_DEFAULT); // fallback with multi-line data
1318  }
1319  }
1320 
1321  if(szLineFeed)
1322  {
1323  cbLF = strlen(szLineFeed);
1324  }
1325 
1326  pRval = WBAlloc(cb1); // allocate the buffer
1327 
1328  if(pRval)
1329  {
1330  p1 = pRval;
1331  for(i1=iRow, p1 = pRval; i1 < pTB->nEntries && i1 <= iEndRow; i1++)
1332  {
1333  char *pTheLine = pTB->aLines[i1];
1334 
1335  // TODO: validate pRval + cb1 > p1 + length of "the stuff that follows"
1336  i2 = i3 = strlen(pTheLine); // the TRUE 'binary' length
1337 
1338  // TODO: for box mode limit the width on all lines and pad with white space as needed
1339 
1340  // TODO: handle hard tab translation? For now "leave it". Later, I should use a character
1341  // that prints as 'white space' but translates as a 'hard tab'.
1342  // Example might be 0xA0, i.e. a ' ' + 80H, filling up spaces to the tab point. Delete
1343  // and insert would have to compensate for this. This function ALSO would have to compensate,
1344  // translating tabs to spaces for box mode, and to hard tabs for everything else when 'select all'
1345  // is not in effect and tabs are preserved.
1346  // For 'select all', hard tabs (when preserved) would be translated into a minimum number of
1347  // tab characters; otherwise they would translate into spaces. Also a hard tab should be displayed
1348  // differently (when preserved), such as a greyed |--> or similar.
1349  // When 'do not preserve tabs' is set, inserted tabs should automatically become spaces. ONLY when
1350  // the tabs are being preserved should the translation take place.
1351  //
1352  // CASE FOR USING 'A0' FOR HARD TAB
1353  // a) UTF8 does not use it as a marker for multi-byte character data - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8
1354  // b) it's basically a ' ' with the high bit set
1355  // c) it's not used for anything significant in 8-bit ASCII other than "non-breaking space" (i.e. &nbsp;)
1356  // d) if it's imported, it will translate to actual spaces
1357  // e) if it's exported by accident, it probably won't matter (other than formatting)
1358  // f) a definition NOW exists - see HARD_TAB_CHAR (text_object.h)
1359 
1360  // last line in 'normal' select mode limits width - 'iEndCol' may be 0
1361  if(i1 == iEndRow // i.e. "the last line" in the selected area
1362  || iIsBoxMode) // box mode limits length differently on all lines
1363  {
1364  if(iIsBoxMode)
1365  {
1366  if(i2 >= iEndCol)
1367  {
1368  i2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iEndCol, NULL) - WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL);
1369  }
1370  else if(iCol > 0)
1371  {
1372  i2 -= WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL) - pTheLine;
1373  }
1374  }
1375  else if(!iIsLineMode)
1376  {
1377  if(i2 >= iEndCol)
1378  {
1379  i2 = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iEndCol, NULL) - pTheLine;
1380  }
1381  }
1382  else if(iEndCol == 0)
1383  {
1384  i2 = 0; // typically 'last row'
1385  }
1386  }
1387 
1388  // check for stream mode on the first line, and start with 'iCol'
1389  if(!iIsBoxMode && !iIsLineMode && i1 == iRow) // on first line, start at 'iCol'
1390  {
1391  i2 -= WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL) - pTheLine; // subtract starting column offset for total length
1392  }
1393 
1394  if(i2 > 0) // might be < 0 depending
1395  {
1396  if(iIsLineMode || i1 > iCol) // multi-line select NOT on first line, or line mode
1397  {
1398  memcpy(p1, pTheLine, i2);
1399  }
1400  else
1401  {
1402  memcpy(p1, WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL), i2);
1403  }
1404  p1 += i2;
1405  }
1406  else
1407  {
1408  i2 = 0; // for box mode, mostly
1409  }
1410 
1411  if(iIsBoxMode) // iRow < iEndRow also
1412  {
1413  // for box mode, pad any 'remaining' length with space
1414  i2 = iEndCol - iCol // the ending width we're SUPPOSED to have
1415  - WBGetMBLength(WBGetMBCharPtr(pTheLine, iCol, NULL)); // the actual length in 'columns' starting at 'iCol'
1416 
1417  // I need THAT MANY white spaces for box mode
1418  if(i2 > 0)
1419  {
1420  memset(p1, ' ', i2);
1421  p1 += i2; // now the width should be exactly 'iEndCol - iCol'
1422  }
1423  }
1424 
1425  // don't add final line feed in 'stream' mode or in 'line' mode if it ends on column 0
1426 
1427  if(iIsBoxMode || // box mode ALWAYS
1428  (iIsLineMode && iEndCol > 0) || // I'm in line mode and NOT ending on column 0 on the last line
1429  i1 < iEndRow) // not the last line
1430  {
1431  if(szLineFeed)
1432  {
1433  memcpy(p1, szLineFeed, cbLF);
1434  p1 += cbLF;
1435  }
1436  }
1437  }
1438 
1439  *p1 = 0;
1440  }
1441  }
1442 
1443  return pRval;
1444 }
1445 
1446 static void __internal_invalidate_cursor(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, int bPaintFlag)
1447 {
1448 WB_RECT rctCursor;
1449

1451  {
1452  rctCursor.left = pThis->iCursorX - 1;
1453  rctCursor.top = pThis->iCursorY - 1;
1454  rctCursor.bottom = rctCursor.top + pThis->iCursorHeight + 2;
1455 
1456  if(pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE)
1457  {
1458  rctCursor.right = rctCursor.left + pThis->iFontWidth;
1459  }
1460  else
1461  {
1462  rctCursor.right = rctCursor.left + 3;
1463  }
1464 
1465  WBInvalidateRect(pThis->wIDOwner, &rctCursor, bPaintFlag);
1466  }

1469 static void __internal_invalidate_rect(struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRect, int bPaintFlag)
1470 {
1471 WB_RECT rctInvalid;
1472 
1473  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis) && pThis->wIDOwner != None)
1474  {
1475  if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->rctView.left || pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->rctView.top ||
1476  pThis->rctWinView.right <= pThis->rctWinView.left || pThis->rctWinView.bottom <= pThis->rctWinView.top ||
1477  memcmp(&pThis->rctView, &pThis->rctViewOld, sizeof(pThis->rctView)) ||
1478  memcmp(&pThis->rctWinView, &pThis->rctWinViewOld, sizeof(pThis->rctWinView)))
1479  {
1480  XClientMessageEvent evt;
1481 
1482  bzero(&evt, sizeof(evt));
1483  evt.type = ClientMessage;
1484  evt.display = WBGetWindowDisplay(pThis->wIDOwner);
1485  evt.window = pThis->wIDOwner;
1486  evt.message_type = aRECALC_LAYOUT;
1487  evt.format = 32;
1488 
1489  WBPostPriorityEvent(pThis->wIDOwner, (XEvent *)&evt); // async (for now)
1490 
1491  memcpy(&pThis->rctViewOld, &pThis->rctView, sizeof(pThis->rctViewOld));
1492  memcpy(&pThis->rctWinViewOld, &pThis->rctWinView, sizeof(pThis->rctWinViewOld));
1493 
1494  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Light | DebugSubSystem_EditWindow | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
1495  "%s,%d - force recalc layout, window %u (%08xH)\n",
1496  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, (int)pThis->wIDOwner, (int)pThis->wIDOwner);
1497  }
1498 
1499  if(!pRect)
1500  {
1501  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Medium | DebugSubSystem_EditWindow | DebugSubSystem_Expose,
1502  "%s - invalidate entire window %u (%08xH)\n",
1503  __FUNCTION__, (int)pThis->wIDOwner, (int)pThis->wIDOwner);
1504 
1505  WBInvalidateRect(pThis->wIDOwner, NULL, bPaintFlag);
1506  return;
1507  }
1508 
1509  memcpy(&rctInvalid, pRect, sizeof(*pRect));
1510 
1511  if(pThis->rctWinView.left - MIN_BORDER_SPACING > rctInvalid.left)
1512  {
1513  rctInvalid.left = pThis->rctWinView.left - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
1514  }
1515  if(pThis->rctWinView.right + MIN_BORDER_SPACING < rctInvalid.right)
1516  {
1517  rctInvalid.right = pThis->rctWinView.right + MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
1518  }
1519  if(pThis->rctWinView.top - MIN_BORDER_SPACING > rctInvalid.top)
1520  {
1521  rctInvalid.top = pThis->rctWinView.top - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
1522  }
1523  if(pThis->rctWinView.bottom + MIN_BORDER_SPACING < rctInvalid.bottom)
1524  {
1525  rctInvalid.bottom = pThis->rctWinView.bottom + MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
1526  }
1527 
1528  WBInvalidateRect(pThis->wIDOwner, &rctInvalid, bPaintFlag);
1529 
1530  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - invalidate %d,%d,%d,%d for %u (%08xH)\n",
1531  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
1532  rctInvalid.left, rctInvalid.top, rctInvalid.right, rctInvalid.bottom,
1533  (int)pThis->wIDOwner, (int)pThis->wIDOwner);
1534 
1535  }
1536 // else
1537 // {
1538 // if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1539 // {
1540 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - invalid text object\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
1541 // }
1542 // else
1543 // {
1544 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - owner window ID is 'None'\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
1545 // }

1549 // NOTE: iStartRow and iStartCol may be 0 but not negative
1550 // iEndRow and iEndCol can be negative to indicate "all"
1551 static void __internal_calc_rect(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRect,
1552  int iStartRow, int iStartCol, int iEndRow, int iEndCol)
1553 {
1554 int iFontHeight;
1555 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
1556 
1557  if(!pRect || !WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1558  {
1559  if(pRect)
1560  {
1561  memset(pRect, 0, sizeof(*pRect));
1562  }
1563 
1564  return;
1565  }
1566 
1567  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText); // might be NULL, must check before use
1568 
1569  if(iEndRow < 0)
1570  {
1571  if(pBuf && pThis->iLineFeed != LineFeed_NONE)
1572  {
1573  iEndRow = pBuf->nEntries;
1574  }
1575  else
1576  {
1577  iEndRow = 0;
1578  }
1579  }
1580 
1581  // examine the viewpoint rect, font height, and other info
1582 
1583  iFontHeight = pThis->iAsc + pThis->iDesc;
1584 
1585  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // i.e. SINGLE LINE (ignore row)
1586  {
1587  // top of line will always be centered
1588 
1589  pRect->top = pThis->rctWinView.top
1590  + (pThis->rctWinView.bottom - pThis->rctWinView.top
1591  - pThis->iAsc - pThis->iDesc)
1592  / 2;
1593 
1594  pRect->bottom = pRect->top + iFontHeight; // always
1595 
1596  pRect->left = pThis->rctWinView.left
1597  + pThis->iFontWidth * (iStartCol - pThis->rctView.left); // can be negative
1598 
1599  if(iEndCol < 0)
1600  {
1601  pRect->right = INT_MAX;
1602  }
1603  else
1604  {
1605  pRect->right = pThis->iFontWidth * (iEndCol - iStartCol + 1);
1606  }
1607  }
1608  else
1609  {
1610 // pThis->rctWinView.top; what did I intend to do here???
1611 
1612  if(iStartRow == iEndRow) // single row
1613  {
1614  pRect->left = pThis->rctWinView.left
1615  + pThis->iFontWidth * (iStartCol - pThis->rctView.left); // can be negative
1616 
1617  if(iEndCol < 0)
1618  {
1619  pRect->right = INT_MAX;
1620  }
1621  else
1622  {
1623  pRect->right = pThis->iFontWidth * (iEndCol - iStartCol + 1);
1624  }
1625 
1626  pRect->top = pThis->rctWinView.top; // already calculated from earlier
1627  pRect->bottom = pRect->top + iFontHeight; // always
1628  }
1629  else // multiple rows implies including the entire line unless ending column is 0 [in which case last line is excluded]
1630  {
1631  // ignore columns, use the entire viewport width
1632  pRect->left = pThis->rctWinView.left;
1633  pRect->right = INT_MAX; //pThis->rctWinView.right;
1634 
1635  iFontHeight = WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc); // height PLUS inter-line spacing
1636 
1637  pRect->top = pThis->rctWinView.top
1638  + iFontHeight * (iStartRow - pThis->rctView.top);
1639 
1640  if(iEndCol > 0)
1641  {
1642  pRect->bottom = pThis->rctWinView.top
1643  + iFontHeight * (iEndRow + 1 - pThis->rctView.top);
1644  }
1645  else // nothing selected on last row
1646  {
1647  pRect->bottom = pThis->rctWinView.top
1648  + iFontHeight * (iEndRow - pThis->rctView.top);
1649  }
1650 
1651  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - merged rect %d,%d,%d,%d\n",
1652  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
1653  pRect->left, pRect->top, pRect->right, pRect->bottom);
1654  }
1655  }
1656 }
1657 
1658 static void __internal_merge_rect(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRect,
1659  int iStartRow, int iStartCol, int iEndRow, int iEndCol)
1660 {
1661 WB_RECT rctMerge;
1662 
1663  if(!pRect || !WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1664  {
1665  if(pRect)
1666  {
1667  memset(pRect, 0, sizeof(*pRect));
1668  }
1669 
1670  return;
1671  }
1672 
1673  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctMerge, iStartRow, iStartCol, iEndRow, iEndCol);
1674 
1675  if(rctMerge.left < pRect->left)
1676  {
1677  pRect->left = rctMerge.left;
1678  }
1679  if(rctMerge.top < pRect->top)
1680  {
1681  pRect->top = rctMerge.top;
1682  }
1683  if(rctMerge.right > pRect->right)
1684  {
1685  pRect->right = rctMerge.right;
1686  }
1687  if(rctMerge.bottom > pRect->bottom)
1688  {
1689  rctMerge.bottom = pRect->bottom;
1690  }
1691 }

1720 static void __internal_init(struct _text_object_ *pThis)

1763  XAllocColor(WBGetDefaultDisplay(), colormap, &(pThis->clrHBG)); // TODO: calculate missing pieces myself?
1764  }
1765 
1766  // TODO: do I re-initialize the owner-maintained values? for now, NO!
1767 
1768  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
1769  {
1770  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it (or in this case, erase it)
1771  }

1788 static void __internal_set_text(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const char *szText, unsigned long cbLen)
1789 {
1790 TEXT_BUFFER *pTemp;
1791 
1792  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1793  {
1794  // for now, allocate a NEW text buffer and replace the old one with it
1795 
1796  pTemp = WBAllocTextBuffer(szText, cbLen);
1797 
1798  if(pTemp)
1799  {
1800  if(pThis->pText)
1801  {
1802  WBFreeTextBuffer(pThis->pText);
1803  }
1804 
1805  pThis->pText = pTemp; // and I'm spent
1806 
1807  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
1808  {
1809  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
1810  }
1811  }
1812  else
1813  {
1814  WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEXT OBJECT: %s - not enough memory for TEXT BUFFER errno=%d (no change)\n", __FUNCTION__, errno);
1815  }
1816  }
1817  else
1818  {
1819  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - NOT a valid TEXT_OBJECT - %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
1820  }
1821 
1822  if(pThis->pText)
1823  {
1824  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pThis->pText);
1825  }
1826 }

1828 static int __internal_get_rows(const struct _text_object_ *pThis)
1829 {
1830 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
1831 
1832  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1833  {
1834  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
1835 
1836  if(pBuf && pBuf->nEntries > 0) // only if NOT empty
1837  {
1838  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE ||
1839  !pBuf->aLines[0] || !*(pBuf->aLines[0])) // strlen(pBuf->aLines[0])) // "blank line"
1840  {
1841  return 1; // for multiline, even a blank line counts as '1'
1842  }
1843 
1844  return pBuf->nEntries + 1; // include the last line (a blank one) in the line count
1845  }
1846  }
1847 
1848  return 0; // assume blank
1849 }
1850 static int __internal_get_cols(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
1851 {
1852 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
1853 int i1;
1854 
1855  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
1856  {
1857  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
1858 
1859  if(pBuf)
1860  {
1861  if(pBuf->nMinMaxCol > pBuf->nMaxCol || !pBuf->nMaxCol || !pBuf->nMinMaxCol)
1862  {
1863  // cache data not valid, so re-evaluate
1864  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pBuf); // re-calculate
1865  }
1866 
1867  if(pBuf->nMaxCol)
1868  {
1869  if(pBuf->nMaxCol < pThis->iCol) // is my current column past the 'max' column?
1870  {
1871  i1 = pThis->iCol + DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH; // use my current column position
1872  }
1873  else
1874  {
1875  i1 = pBuf->nMaxCol + DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH; // use the 'max' column position
1876  }
1877 
1878  return i1 - (i1 % DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH); // rounded off to 'DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH'
1879  // so if DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH is 8, then 1 becomes 8, 8 becomes 16, etc.
1880  }
1881  }
1882  else if(pThis->iCol > 0) // allow for 'scrolling without any actual data yet'
1883  {
1884  i1 = pThis->iCol + DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH; // use my current column position
1885  return i1 - (i1 % DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH); // rounded off to 'DEFAULT_TAB_WIDTH'
1886  }
1887 
1888  // all other conditions fall through and return 0
1889  }
1890 
1891  return 0; // assume blank
1892 }

1914 static int __internal_get_linefeed(const struct _text_object_ *pThis)
1915 {

1994 static void __internal_get_select(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, WB_RECT *pRct)

2005  pRct->bottom = -1;

2007  else

2010 
2011  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis)) // if not empty
2012  {
2013  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(*pRct); // normalize the results
2014  }
2015  }
2016  }
2017  }

2028  = 0; // select NONE

2044 static char* __internal_get_sel_text(const struct _text_object_ *pThis, const WB_RECT *pRct)
2045 {
2046 WB_RECT rctSel;
2047 
2048  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2049  {
2050  if(pRct)
2051  {
2052  if(pRct->left == pRct->right && pRct->top == pRct->bottom)
2053  {
2054  return NULL; // empty
2055  }
2056  else if(pRct->left < 0) // a flag for 'select all'
2057  {
2058  return __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, -1, -1, -1, -1);
2059  }
2060 
2061  memcpy(&rctSel, pRct, sizeof(rctSel));
2062  }
2063  else
2064  {
2065  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
2066  {
2067  return NULL;
2068  }
2069  else if(SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis))
2070  {
2071  return __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, -1, -1, -1, -1);
2072  }
2073 
2074  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
2075  }
2076 
2077  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
2078 
2079  return __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, rctSel.top, rctSel.left,
2080  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right);
2081  }
2082  return NULL; // for now
2083 }

2116 static void __internal_set_col(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iCol)
2117 {
2118 int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
2119 
2120 
2121  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2122  {
2123  pThis->iCol = iCol; // for now, assign "as-is"
2124 
2125  // auto-scroll viewport for single-line only
2126 
2127  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE && // single-line, do auto-scrolling
2128  pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left) // in case the view area is empty
2129  {
2130  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
2131  {
2132  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
2133  }
2134 
2135  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
2136 
2137  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2138  {
2139  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2140  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2141  }
2142  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
2143  {
2144  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
2145  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
2146  }
2147  }
2148 
2149  if(pThis->pText &&
2150  WBTextBufferLineLength(pThis->pText, pThis->iRow) < iCol)
2151  {
2152  WBTextBufferLineChange(pThis->pText, pThis->iRow, iCol);
2153 // WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pThis->pText);
2154  }
2155  }
2156 }
2157 static void __internal_del_select(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
2158 {
2159 char *pTemp, *pL;
2160 int iSelAll, iLen, i1, i2;
2161 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
2162 WB_RECT rctSel;
2163 
2164 
2165  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2166  {
2167  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0);
2168  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
2169 
2170  iSelAll = SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis); // identifies "select all"
2171 
2172  if(!iSelAll && SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
2173  {
2174  // no selection, do nothing
2175  return;
2176  }
2177 
2178  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
2179 
2180  if(!pBuf || (pThis->rctSel.top >= pBuf->nEntries && pThis->rctSel.bottom >= pBuf->nEntries))
2181  {
2182  return; // NO buffer, or select area is outside of buffer area
2183  }
2184 
2185  // for the undo buffer I will need a copy of the original text.
2186  // this function only returns NULL on error
2187 
2188  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
2189 
2190  if(iSelAll)
2191  {
2192  pTemp = __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, -1, -1, -1, -1);
2193  }
2194  else
2195  {
2196  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
2197 
2198  pTemp = __internal_get_selected_text(pThis, rctSel.top, rctSel.left,
2199  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right);
2200  }
2201 
2202  if(iSelAll)
2203  {
2204  // delete all
2205  if(pThis->pText)
2206  {
2207  WBFreeTextBuffer(pThis->pText);
2208  pThis->pText = NULL;
2209  }
2210 
2211  if(pTemp)
2212  {
2213  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2214  0, 0, &(pThis->rctSel), pTemp, -1,
2215  pBuf->nEntries, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
2216  }
2217  }
2218  else if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE ||
2219  rctSel.top == rctSel.bottom) // single-line selection (all methods behave the same)
2220  {
2221  // delete from rctSel.left to rctSel.right (exclusive)
2222 
2223  pL = pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top];
2224 
2225  if(pL)
2226  {
2227  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pL);
2228  if(iLen >= rctSel.left)
2229  {
2230  if(iLen <= rctSel.right)
2231  {
2232  char *pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.left, NULL);
2233  if(pTempL)
2234  {
2235  *pTempL = 0; // just truncate the string
2236  }
2237  }
2238  else
2239  {
2240  char *pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.left, NULL);
2241  char *pTempR = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.right, NULL);
2242 
2243  if(pTempL && pTempR)
2244  {
2245  strcpy(pTempL, pTempR); // thereby squeezing the string together and deleting the selection
2246  }
2247  }
2248  }
2249  }
2250 
2251  if(pTemp)
2252  {
2253  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2254  rctSel.top, rctSel.left, &(pThis->rctSel),
2255  pTemp, -1,
2256  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right, NULL, NULL, 0);
2257  }
2258 
2259  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE && // special case, auto-hscroll
2260  pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
2261  {
2262  int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
2263 
2264  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
2265  {
2266  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
2267  }
2268 
2269  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
2270 
2271  while(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2272  {
2273  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2274  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2275  }
2276  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
2277  {
2278  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
2279  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
2280  }
2281  }
2282 
2283  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pThis->pText);
2284  }
2285  else if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_BOX) // multiline delete BOX mode
2286  {
2287  }
2288  else if(pThis->iSelMode == SelectMode_LINE) // multiline delete LINE mode
2289  {
2290  }
2291  else // default 'char'
2292  {
2293  if(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] && rctSel.left > 0)
2294  {
2295  pL = pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top];
2296 
2297  if(rctSel.right > 0)
2298  {
2299  char *pJoin, *pNew;
2300 
2301  pJoin = WBGetMBCharPtr(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.bottom], rctSel.right, NULL);
2302  pNew = WBJoinMBLine(pL, rctSel.left, pJoin);
2303 
2304  if(!pNew) // error
2305  {
2306  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR - %s - memory allocation error, errno=%d\n", __FUNCTION__, errno);
2307  return; // no undo buffer when there's a memory error
2308  }
2309  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] = pNew;
2310  if(pL) // just in case
2311  {
2312  WBFree(pL);
2313  }
2314 
2315  i2 = rctSel.bottom + 1; // start copying the NEXT line
2316  }
2317  else
2318  {
2319  char *pTemp = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.left, NULL);
2320  if(pTemp) // just in case
2321  {
2322  *pTemp = 0; // truncate line at this position
2323  }
2324 
2325  i2 = rctSel.bottom; // start copying THIS line (since I'm not joining them)
2326  }
2327 
2328  for(i1=pThis->rctSel.top + 1; i2 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++, i2++)
2329  {
2330  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
2331  {
2332  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
2333  }
2334  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i2];
2335  pBuf->aLines[i2] = NULL; // for now, to prevent accidental pointer re-use later
2336  }
2337 
2338  pBuf->nEntries = i1;
2339  }
2340  else
2341  {
2342  if(rctSel.right == 0) // an even number of lines is being deleted
2343  {
2344  for(i1=rctSel.top, i2=rctSel.bottom; i2 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++, i2++)
2345  {
2346  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
2347  {
2348  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
2349  }
2350  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i2];
2351  pBuf->aLines[i2] = NULL; // for now, to prevent accidental pointer re-use later
2352  }
2353 
2354  pBuf->nEntries = i1;
2355  }
2356  else // uneven lines
2357  {
2358  // top line will become partial bottom line
2359  pL = pBuf->aLines[rctSel.bottom];
2360 
2361  if(pL)
2362  {
2363  char *pTempR = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, rctSel.right, NULL);
2364  if(pTempR)
2365  {
2366  strcpy(pL, pTempR);
2367  }
2368  else
2369  {
2370  *pL = 0; // for now, truncate the line if this happens
2371  }
2372  }
2373 
2374  if(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top])
2375  {
2376  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top]);
2377  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] = NULL; // by convention (it's re-assigned in the next line though)
2378  }
2379 
2380  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top] = pL;
2381  pBuf->aLines[rctSel.bottom] = NULL; // by convention, to prevent re-use of pointer
2382 
2383  for(i1=rctSel.top + 1, i2=rctSel.bottom + 1; i2 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++, i2++)
2384  {
2385  if(pBuf->aLines[i1])
2386  {
2387  WBFree(pBuf->aLines[i1]);
2388  pBuf->aLines[i1] = NULL; // by convention (re-assigned in next line)
2389  }
2390 
2391  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i2];
2392  pBuf->aLines[i2] = NULL; // by convention, to prevent accidental pointer re-use later
2393  }
2394 
2395  pBuf->nEntries = i1;
2396  }
2397  }
2398 
2399  // update cached line length info
2400 
2401  if(rctSel.bottom == rctSel.top) // same line delete
2402  {
2403  int iNewLen = 0;
2404 
2405  if(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top])
2406  {
2407  iNewLen = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[rctSel.top]);
2408  }
2409 
2410  WBTextBufferLineChange(pThis->pText, rctSel.top, iNewLen);
2411  }
2412  else if((rctSel.bottom - rctSel.top) == 1) // single-line delete
2413  {
2414  WBTextBufferLineChange(pThis->pText, rctSel.top, -1); // deleted line
2415  }
2416  else // multi-line
2417  {
2418  WBTextBufferRefreshCache(pThis->pText);
2419  }
2420 
2421  if(pTemp)
2422  {
2423  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_DELETE, pThis->iSelMode,
2424  rctSel.top, rctSel.left, &(pThis->rctSel),
2425  pTemp, -1,
2426  rctSel.bottom, rctSel.right, NULL, NULL, 0);
2427  }
2428  }
2429 
2430  if(pTemp)
2431  {
2432  WBFree(pTemp);
2433  }
2434 
2435  // once the selection has been deleted, select 'nothing' and re-paint all
2436  // and of course, iRow and iCol will be at the left/top of the selection
2437 
2438  // NOTE: this assumes that the data is consistent
2439 
2440  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->rctSel.bottom = 0;
2441 
2442  if(iSelAll)
2443  {
2444  pThis->iRow = pThis->iCol = 0;
2445  }
2446  else
2447  {
2448  pThis->iRow = rctSel.top;
2449  pThis->iCol = rctSel.left;
2450  }
2451 
2452  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
2453  {
2454  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2455  }
2456 
2457  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
2458 
2459  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // TODO: optimize this
2460  }
2461 }
2462 static void __internal_replace_select(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const char *szText, unsigned long cbLen)
2463 {
2464 WB_RECT rctSel;
2465 int iSelAll;
2466 
2467  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2468  {
2469  int iOldIns; //, iOldRow, iOldCol;
2470 
2471  if(pThis->iRow < 0 || pThis->iCol< 0)
2472  {
2473  pThis->iRow = 0;
2474  pThis->iCol = 0;
2475  }
2476 
2477 // NOTE: iOldRow and iOldCol not being used; commented out because of linux gcc warnings
2478 // iOldRow = pThis->iRow;
2479 // iOldCol = pThis->iCol;
2480  iOldIns = pThis->iInsMode;
2481 
2482  iSelAll = SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis);
2483 
2484  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
2485 
2486  if(iSelAll)
2487  {
2488  pThis->iRow = 0;
2489  pThis->iCol = 0;
2490  }
2491  else if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
2492  {
2493  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
2494 
2495  pThis->iRow = rctSel.top;
2496  pThis->iCol = rctSel.left;
2497  }
2498 
2499  pThis->iInsMode = InsertMode_INSERT;
2500 
2501  // TODO: if box mode, height/width may need to match. for now, don't care
2502 
2503  if(!iSelAll && SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis)) // not 'ALL'
2504  {
2505  __internal_ins_chars(pThis, szText, cbLen); // just insert the text (no selection)
2506 
2507  // NOTE: select rectangle remains empty
2508  }
2509  else
2510  {
2511  // for now delete the selection, then insert the new characters
2512  // this will take into consideration the select mode
2513  __internal_del_select(pThis); // this also clears the selection
2514 
2515  // new selection starts at rctSel.top, rctSel.left
2516 
2517  __internal_ins_chars(pThis, szText, cbLen); // just insert the text (no selection)
2518 
2519  // new selection ends at iRow, iCol
2520 
2521  rctSel.right = pThis->iRow;
2522  rctSel.bottom = pThis->iCol;
2523 
2524  // assign the new select rectangle to become the text I just added.
2525  memcpy(&(pThis->rctSel), &rctSel, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
2526  }
2527 
2528 // pThis->iRow = iOldRow;
2529 // pThis->iCol = iOldCol;
2530  pThis->iInsMode = iOldIns;
2531 
2532  // todo: mark a NEW selection using the inserted text? this might mean replicating code for
2533  // __internal_del_select and __internal_ins_chars and processing undo here
2534 
2535 
2536  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
2537  {
2538  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
2539  }
2540 
2541  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
2542  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // TODO: optimize this
2543 
2544  // NOTE: no need to call WBTextBufferRefreshCache(), the 'del_select' and 'ins_chars' would've done it
2545 
2546  }
2547 }
2548 static void __internal_del_chars(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int nChar)
2549 {
2550 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
2551 int i1, i2, iLen;
2552 char *pL, *pL2, *pL3;
2553 WB_RECT rctInvalid;
2554 
2555 
2556  if(!nChar)
2557  {
2558  return; // does nothing
2559  }
2560 
2561  // NOTE: nChar < 0 deletes to the left (like a backspace), >0 deletes to the right like 'Del' normally would
2562  // If the cursor is at the end of the line or the start of the line, an appropriate delete will
2563  // merge the previous (or next) line. Values of |nChar| greater than the number of characters remaining
2564  // in the line (from the cursor) _STOP_ at the beginning/end of the line. Only a delete with cursor
2565  // AT the beginning or end of the line will merge. Merge also considers the virtual cursor position.
2566 
2567  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
2568  {
2569  return; // error
2570  }
2571 
2572  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0);
2573  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
2574 
2575  if(nChar > 0 || (pThis->iCol == 0 && pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE))
2576  {
2577  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + 1);
2578  }

2580  {

2582  }

2595  }

2600

2609

2611  (pThis->iRow <= 0 || pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE)) // single line and backspace past begin of column
2612  {
2613  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s - backspace while I'm at start of file\n", __FUNCTION__);
2614  return; // exit
2615  }
2616

2618  (pThis->iRow >= pBuf->nEntries ||
2619  pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE)) // single line and backspace past begin of column
2620  {
2621  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s - delete while I'm past end of file\n", __FUNCTION__);
2622 
2623  return; // exit
2624  }
2625

2627

2630  {
2631  // this backspace will merge the previous line with this one
2632

2634  if(!pL2)
2635  {
2636  pThis->iCol = 0; // a kind of 'fallback' - put column cursor at zero
2637 
2638  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow - 1] = pL; // move line to THIS position
2639  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = NULL; // pre-emptive, avoid sharing pointers
2640 
2641  pL = NULL;
2642  }
2643  else
2644  {
2645  if(pL) // can be NULL, which is a blank line
2646  {
2647  i2 = WBGetMBLength(pL2); // now THIS is the new column position
2648 
2649  pL2 = WBJoinMBLine(pL2, i2, pL);
2650 
2651  if(!pL2)

2653  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory to join lines\n", __FUNCTION__);
2654 
2655  return; // do nothing (TODO: error message?)
2656  }
2657 
2658  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow - 1] = pL2; // the new pointer
2659  }
2660  else
2661  {
2662  i2 = 0;
2663  }
2664 
2665  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = NULL; // pre-emptive, avoid sharing pointers
2666 
2667  pThis->iCol = i2; // the new position (end of previous line)
2668 
2669  WBFree(pL);
2670  pL = NULL; // pre-emptive, avoid shared pointers
2671  }
2672 
2673  // if I hit backspace while on row==nEntries, just move the cursor to the end
2674  // of the previous line. I'm not really deleting anything.
2675  if(pThis->iRow >= pBuf->nEntries) // beyond the last line?
2676  {
2677  pThis->iRow--;
2678  if(pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow])
2679  {
2680  pThis->iCol = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow]);
2681  }
2682 
2683  // NOTE: no need to update the line's length in the buffer cache, I didn't change anything
2684  }
2685  else
2686  {
2687  // at this point, 'iRow - 1' is the 'replaced' row, so I need to move rows such that
2688  // I start with 'iRow + 1' and assign to 'i1 - 1'. this works.
2689  for(i1=pThis->iRow + 1; i1 < pBuf->nEntries; i1++)

2703  }

2713  }

2726  pL, pThis->iCol, pL2);

2729

2733

2738  }
2739

2741  }

2744

2747  {
2748  pBuf->aLines[i1] = pBuf->aLines[i1 + 1];
2749  }

2757

2759

2761  pThis->iRow, iLen, &(pThis->rctSel),
2762  "\n", 1,
2763  pThis->iRow + 1, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
2764

2899  }
2900  else
2901  {

2903  // so it's a condition that was SUPPOSED to be tested for, but wasn't.
2904

2906  __FUNCTION__, nChar, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, (int)pBuf->nEntries);
2907 
2908  break;
2909  }
2910  }
2911 
2912  // implement auto-hscroll while deleting
2913 
2914  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
2915  {
2916  if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
2917  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
2918  {

2920 
2921  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
2922  {
2923  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
2924  }
2925 
2926  // scroll left/right to expose the cursor
2927

2929  {
2930  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2931  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
2932  }
2933  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
2934  {
2935  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
2936  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
2937  }
2938

2940  {

2942  }
2943 
2944  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
2945  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
2946  }
2947  else
2948  {
2949  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback) // TODO: if I only need to invalidate one line, should I just do that?
2950  {

2952  }
2953 
2954  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
2955  // for now, always do this
2956  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
2957 // __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, 1); // invalidate bounding rectangle
2958  }
2959  }
2960  else

2965  }
2966 
2967  // for now, always do this
2968  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
2969

2971 
2972 // __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, 1); // invalidate bounding rectangle

2976 static void __internal_ins_chars(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const char *pChar, int nChar)
2977 {
2978 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
2979 const char *p1, *p2;
2980 char *pL, *pTemp;
2981 int i1, iLen=0, iMultiLine = 0;
2982 WB_RECT rctInvalid;
2983 
2984 
2985  if(!pChar || !nChar)
2986  {
2987  return;
2988  }
2989 
2990  if(nChar < 0)
2991  {
2992  nChar = strlen(pChar);
2993  }
2994 
2995  p1 = pChar;
2996  p2 = pChar + nChar;
2997 
2998 
2999  // FIRST, see if the insert is single-line or multi-line and act accordingly
3000 
3001  while(p1 < p2)
3002  {
3003  if(*p1 == '\n' || *p1 == '\r')
3004  {
3005  iMultiLine = 1;
3006  break; // this will be used in single-line mode to mark "stop here"
3007  }
3008 
3009  p1++;
3010  }
3011 
3012  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // always do this
3013 
3014  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3015  {
3016  if(pThis->iRow < 0 || pThis->iCol< 0)
3017  {
3018  pThis->iRow = 0;
3019  pThis->iCol = 0;
3020  }
3021 
3022  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0);
3023  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET;
3024  // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
3025 
3026  __internal_calc_rect(pThis, &rctInvalid, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, pThis->iRow, -1);
3027  // always refresh entire line from 'iCol' forward
3028 
3029  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
3030 
3031  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
3032  {
3033  if(iMultiLine)
3034  {
3035  iMultiLine = 0;
3036  p2 = p1; // either end of string, or the position of the newline
3037  }
3038 
3039  p1 = pChar;
3040 
3041  // insert at 'iCol'
3042 
3043  if(!pBuf) // no buffer, so add text now
3044  {
3045  pBuf = pThis->pText = WBAllocTextBuffer(p1, p2 - p1); // this copies the data, too
3046 
3047  pThis->iRow = 0; // always
3048  pThis->iCol = WBGetMBColIndex(p1, p2); // the col index of 'p2' within 'p1' ('MB' length of 'p1 through p2')
3049  // new col will be 'end of string'. by using this value, it's effectively, like pressing 'end' after inserting
3050 
3051  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_INSERT, pThis->iSelMode,
3052  pThis->iRow, 0, &(pThis->rctSel), NULL, 0, // old col was 0, always
3053  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, NULL, // new col already assigned
3054  p1, p2 - p1); // the new text
3055  }
3056  else if(p2 > p1) // adding text to existing buffer
3057  {
3058  if(pThis->iRow != 0)
3059  {
3060  pThis->iRow = 0; // force it
3061  }
3062 
3063  iLen = 0; // pre-assign for later (so it won't be "unassigned" by accident on error)
3064 
3065  //------------------------------------------------
3066  // calculating buffer size, allocating line buffer
3067  //------------------------------------------------
3068 
3069  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0 || !pBuf->aLines[0])
3070  {
3071  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0)
3072  {
3073  pBuf->nEntries = 1; // single-line, always this, but not verifying for now
3074  }
3075 
3076  pL = pBuf->aLines[0] = WBAlloc(pThis->iCol + p2 - p1 + 2);
3077 
3078  if(pL)
3079  {
3080  if(pThis->iCol > 0) // this works because a space is always 1 byte long
3081  {
3082  memset(pL, ' ', pThis->iCol);
3083  pL[pThis->iCol] = 0;
3084  }
3085 
3086  iLen = pThis->iCol;
3087  }
3088  }
3089  else
3090  {
3091  pTemp = pBuf->aLines[0];
3092 
3093  i1 = strlen(pTemp); // the actual length
3094 
3095  iLen = WBGetMBLength(pTemp); // the # of columns
3096 
3097  if(iLen < pThis->iCol)
3098  {
3099  i1 += pThis->iCol - iLen; // add the alloc length for white space following 'iCol'
3100  }
3101 
3102  if(pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE &&
3103  iLen >= pThis->iCol) // only if I actually overwrite something
3104  {
3105  if(iLen < pThis->iCol + WBGetMBColIndex(p1, p2)) // will overwrite extend the string??
3106  {
3107  char *pTempC = WBGetMBCharPtr(pTemp, pThis->iCol, NULL);
3108 
3109  if(pTempC)
3110  {
3111  i1 = (pTempC - pTemp) + (p2 - p1); // extent of teh text I'm adding when I overwrite
3112  }
3113  else
3114  {
3115  i1 += p2 - p1; // fallback in case of problems
3116  }
3117  }
3118  }
3119  else
3120  {
3121  i1 += p2 - p1; // I'm extending the string by 'that much'
3122  }
3123 
3124  pL = WBReAlloc(pTemp, i1 + 2);
3125 
3126  if(pL)
3127  {
3128  pBuf->aLines[0] = pL;
3129  }
3130  else
3131  {
3132  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - not enough memory\n", __FUNCTION__);
3133  }
3134  }
3135 
3136  //-------------------------------------------
3137  // copying data into buffer at column 'iCol'
3138  //-------------------------------------------
3139 
3140  if(pL)
3141  {
3142  char *pTempL;
3143  if(iLen < pThis->iCol)
3144  {
3145  pTempL = pL + strlen(pL); // will always be this
3146 
3147  memset(pTempL, ' ', pThis->iCol - iLen); // pad with spaces
3148 
3149  pTempL += pThis->iCol - iLen; // advance the pointer to where 'iCol' is
3150  *pTempL = 0; // make sure it ends in a zero byte
3151  }
3152  else if(iLen > pThis->iCol && // insert 'in the middle'
3153  pThis->iInsMode != InsertMode_OVERWRITE) // NOT overwriting
3154  {
3155  pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL);
3156 
3157  // make room for text
3158  if(WB_LIKELY((iLen - pThis->iCol + 1) > 0)) // probably always true
3159  {
3160  memmove(pTempL + (p2 - p1), pTempL, strlen(pTempL) + 1); // note that this includes the zero byte at the end
3161  }
3162  }
3163  else if((p2 - p1) + pThis->iCol >= iLen) // overwriting AND it extends the buffer?
3164  {
3165  pTempL = WBGetMBCharPtr(pL, pThis->iCol, NULL);
3166 
3167  pTempL[p2 - p1] = 0; // I need a terminating zero byte immediately after where the text will go
3168  }
3169 
3170  __internal_add_undo(pThis, UNDO_INSERT, pThis->iSelMode,
3171  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, &(pThis->rctSel),
3172  (pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE && pThis->iCol < iLen ?
3173  pL + pThis->iCol : NULL), // for overwrite, it's the original text
3174  (pThis->iInsMode == InsertMode_OVERWRITE && pThis->iCol < iLen ?
3175  p2 - p1 : 0), // length of old text for overwrite
3176  pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol + (p2 - p1), NULL,
3177  p1, p2 - p1); // the new text
3178

3180

3182  }
3183  }
3184 
3185  if(pThis->pColorContextCallback)
3186  {
3187  pThis->pColorContextCallback(pThis, -1, -1); // to refresh it
3188  }
3189  }

3191  {
3192

3194 
3195  // insert at 'iCol'

3201 
3202  pBuf = pThis->pText = WBAllocTextBuffer(pChar, nChar);

3211  }

3229 
3230  // NOTE: if hard tabs are supported, I will be storing the white space
3231  // as a special character
3232  }
3233

3235  }
3236

3238  // either a '\r' or a '\n' (which will be inserted)
3239 
3240  // there are 3 scenarious:
3241  // a) inserting a line feed (no text)
3242  // b) inserting text without a line feed
3243  // c) inserting text WITH a line feed (or more than one line feed)
3244  //
3245  // and the insert condition: insert OR overwrite
3246  // a) if overwrite exceeds the length of the line, it appends to the same line.
3247  // b) if overwrite 'overwrites' with a line feed, it acts like 'insert' at that point (gedit does this too)
3248  // c) if insert or overwrite adds a line feed, a new line is created with the remaining text from the line
3249  // and subsequent lines are moved down by 1 to make space for it
3250 
3251  // I'll deal with 'inserting text' first, then the line feed separately
3252 
3253  // TODO: use WBSplitMBLine() if there's a linefeed
3254  // otherwise, WBInsertMBChars()

3261  }

3264  + nTabs * pThis->iTab // extra space for tabs
3265  + 2); // 2 additional spaces

3270  {
3271  memset(pL, ' ', pThis->iCol);
3272  }
3273

3275 
3276  iLen = pThis->iCol; // in this case it will be
3277  }
3278  }
3279  else
3280  {
3281  pL = NULL; // a flag for success-testing
3282

3327  }

3331  + nTabs * pThis->iTab // extra space for tabs
3332  + 2); // allocate to fit (plus 2 extra chars)
3333  }

3337  pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow] = pL;
3338  }
3339  else

3342  }
3343  }
3344  }
3345

3354

3356  }

3388  }

3402  }

3405

3455  }
3456 
3457  // auto-hscroll while inserting text, make sure cursor position is visible
3458 
3459  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
3460  {

3462  pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
3463  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)

3466

3468  {

3470  }

3476  pThis->rctView.left -= iAutoScrollWidth;
3477  pThis->rctView.right -= iAutoScrollWidth;
3478  }
3479  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
3480  {
3481  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
3482  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
3483  }
3484 
3485  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
3486  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling, so invalidate everything
3487  }
3488  else

3498  }

3500  if(iMultiLine || !pBuf)

3562 static void __internal_set_view_origin(struct _text_object_ *pThis, const WB_POINT *pOrig)
3563 {
3564  if(!pOrig)
3565  {
3566  return;
3567  }
3568 
3569  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3570  {
3571  int nRows = __internal_get_rows(pThis);
3572  int nCols = __internal_get_cols(pThis);
3573 
3574  nRows -= (pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top); // note that 'nRows' includes the blank line at the end
3575  if(nRows < 0)
3576  {
3577  nRows = 0;
3578  }
3579 
3580  nCols -= (pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left - 4); // TODO: what constant do I subtract?
3581  if(nCols < 0)
3582  {
3583  nCols = 0;
3584  }
3585 
3586  if(pOrig->x < 0)
3587  {
3588  nCols = 0;
3589  }
3590  else if(pOrig->x < nCols)
3591  {
3592  nCols = pOrig->x;
3593  }
3594 
3595  if(pOrig->y < 0)
3596  {
3597  nRows = 0;
3598  }
3599  else if(pOrig->y < nRows)
3600  {
3601  nRows = pOrig->y;
3602  }
3603 
3604  if(nRows != pThis->rctView.top || nCols != pThis->rctView.left)
3605  {
3606  pThis->rctView.bottom = (pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top)
3607  + nRows;
3608  pThis->rctView.top = nRows;
3609 
3610  pThis->rctView.right = (pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
3611  + nCols;
3612  pThis->rctView.left = nCols;
3613 
3614  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate the display and re-draw
3615  }
3616  }

3632 static void __internal_mouse_click(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int iMouseXDelta, int iMouseYDelta, int iType, int iACS)
3633 {
3634 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
3635 int iRow = -1, iCol = -1; // pre-assign error returns
3636 int iFontHeight;
3637 WB_RECT rctSel;
3638 
3639  // NOTE: if this has never been painted, I can't respond to this request
3640 
3641  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3642  {
3643  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
3644 
3645  memset(&rctSel, 0, sizeof(rctSel));
3646 
3647  if(!(pThis->iDragState & DragState_MOUSE)) // not mouse-dragging at the moment
3648  {
3649  // clear the selection if there is one
3650  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3651  {
3652  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
3653 
3654  // clearing the selection (TODO: do this with a utility function?)
3655  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
3656  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
3657  }
3658  }
3659 
3660  iFontHeight = pThis->iAsc + pThis->iDesc;
3661 
3662  if(iFontHeight && pThis->iFontWidth &&
3663  pThis->rctWinView.left < pThis->rctWinView.right &&
3664  pThis->rctWinView.top < pThis->rctWinView.bottom)
3665  {
3666  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // i.e. "single line"
3667  {
3668  iRow = 0; // always
3669  }
3670  else
3671  {
3672  iFontHeight = WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc);
3673 
3674  iRow = pThis->rctView.top
3675  + (iMouseYDelta + iFontHeight / 4 - pThis->rctWinView.top) / iFontHeight;
3676 
3677  if(iRow < 0 || !pBuf)
3678  {
3679  iRow = 0;
3680  }
3681  else if(iRow > pBuf->nEntries)
3682  {
3683  iRow = pBuf->nEntries;
3684  }
3685  }
3686 
3687  // column calculation is no different between single-line and multi-line
3688  iCol = pThis->rctView.left
3689  + (iMouseXDelta + pThis->iFontWidth / 4 - pThis->rctWinView.left) / pThis->iFontWidth;
3690 
3691  if(iCol < 0 || !pBuf || iRow >= pBuf->nEntries || !pBuf->aLines[iRow])
3692  {
3693  iCol = 0; // for now also force column 0 if there's no buffer or a NULL entry for it or at end of document
3694  }
3695  else if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE &&
3696  iCol > WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[iRow]))
3697  {
3698  iCol = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[iRow]); // don't select pos past end of line for single-line edit
3699  }
3700  }
3701 
3702  // if I am doing a mouse-drag, and the selection is empty, start a new selection.
3703  // if I am doing a cursor-drag, disable it.
3704 
3705  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
3706  {
3707  pThis->iDragState = DragState_NONE; // turn it off now.
3708 
3709  if(iType == WB_POINTER_BUTTON1 && iACS == 0) // only if left-click for now
3710  {
3711  pThis->iCol = iCol;
3712  pThis->iRow = iRow;
3713  }
3714  }
3715  else if(!(pThis->iDragState & DragState_MOUSE))
3716  {
3717  if(iType == WB_POINTER_BUTTON1 && iACS == 0) // only if left-click for now
3718  {
3719  pThis->iCol = iCol;
3720  pThis->iRow = iRow;
3721  }
3722  else
3723  {
3724  pThis->iDragState = DragState_NONE; // turn dragging off
3725 
3726  // TODO: check for wheel buttons WB_POINTER_BUTTON4 and WB_POINTER_BUTTON5 ?
3727  }
3728  }
3729  else if(iType == 0 && iACS == 0) // a mouse motion message while dragging
3730  {
3731  // see if the select rectangle is empty. If it is, then I
3732  // am just starting the drag and I need to anchor the cursor
3733 
3734  // NOTE: cursor anchor is always (left,top) even if it's a negative distance
3735 
3736  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3737  {
3738  pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->iRow; // old row
3739  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->iCol; // previous column
3740  }
3741 
3742  pThis->rctSel.bottom = iRow; // new row
3743  pThis->rctSel.right = iCol; // new column
3744 
3745  pThis->iCol = iCol;
3746  pThis->iRow = iRow;
3747  }
3748  else
3749  {
3750  // TODO: cancel dragging? or not... [maybe check for right-click or scroll]
3751 
3752  // TODO: check for wheel buttons WB_POINTER_BUTTON4 and WB_POINTER_BUTTON5 ?
3753  // for a mouse drag I may enable this, but probably should just shut off the drag
3754  // maybe shift+wheel would select...? testing it shows that it scrolls the viewport
3755 
3756  pThis->iDragState = DragState_NONE; // turn dragging off, for now
3757  }
3758 
3759  // for now mouse-click invalidates the entire rectangle. Later I fix this.
3760 
3761  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
3762 
3763  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1);
3764  }

3782 static void __internal_cursor_up(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
3783 {
3784 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
3785 
3786 
3787  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
3788  {
3789  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
3790  }
3791  else
3792  {
3793  int iOldRow = pThis->iRow;
3794 
3795  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
3796 
3797  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
3798  {
3799  return; // do nothing
3800  }
3801 
3802  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
3803 
3804  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
3805 
3806  if(!pBuf)
3807  {
3808  pThis->iRow = 0;
3809  pThis->iCol = 0;
3810  }
3811  else if(pBuf->nEntries < pThis->iRow)
3812  {
3813  pThis->iRow = pBuf->nEntries;
3814  pThis->iCol = 0;
3815  }
3816  else if(pThis->iRow > 0)
3817  {
3818  pThis->iRow--;
3819  }
3820  else
3821  {
3822  pThis->iRow = 0;
3823  }
3824 
3825  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
3826  {
3827  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3828  {
3829  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->iCol;
3830  pThis->rctSel.top = iOldRow;
3831  }
3832 
3833  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
3834  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
3835  }
3836  else
3837  {
3838  // clear the selection if there is one
3839  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
3840  {
3841  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
3842  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
3843  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
3844  }
3845  }
3846 
3847  if(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow ||
3848  pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
3849  {
3850  WB_WARN_PRINT("WARNING: %s line %d - invalidate entire window rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
3851 
3852  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // scrolling invalidates all
3853 
3854  // scroll right/left so that I have one additional white space visible
3855  if(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow)
3856  {
3857  pThis->rctView.bottom -= (pThis->rctView.top - pThis->iRow);
3858  pThis->rctView.top = pThis->iRow; // new top row
3859  }
3860  else if(pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
3861  {
3862  pThis->rctView.top += pThis->iRow + 1 - pThis->rctView.bottom;
3863  pThis->rctView.bottom = pThis->iRow + 1;
3864  }
3865  }
3866  else // re-calculate cursor metrics
3867  {
3868  pThis->iCursorY += WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc)
3869  * (pThis->iRow - iOldRow); // will effectively subtract
3870 
3871  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1); // invalidate the NEW cursor rectangle
3872  }
3873  }
3874 }

4176 static void __internal_page_up(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
4177 {
4178 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4179 
4180  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4181  {
4182  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4183  }
4184  else
4185  {
4186  int iOldRow = pThis->iRow;
4187  int iPageHeight = pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top;
4188 
4189  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4190 
4191  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
4192  {
4193  return; // do nothing
4194  }
4195 
4196  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
4197 
4198  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4199 
4200  if(!pBuf)
4201  {
4202  pThis->iRow = 0;
4203  pThis->iCol = 0;
4204  }
4205  else if(pThis->iRow <= iPageHeight)
4206  {
4207  if(pThis->iRow <= 0) // check for negatives anyway
4208  {
4209  pThis->iCol = 0; // page-up on top line homes the cursor
4210  }
4211 
4212  pThis->iRow = 0;
4213  }
4214  else
4215  {
4216  pThis->iRow -= iPageHeight;
4217  }
4218 
4219  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
4220  {
4221  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4222  {
4223  pThis->rctSel.left = pThis->iCol;
4224  pThis->rctSel.top = iOldRow;
4225  }
4226 
4227  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
4228  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
4229  }
4230  else
4231  {
4232  // clear the selection if there is one
4233  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4234  {
4235  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
4236  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
4237  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
4238  }
4239  }
4240 
4241  if(WB_LIKELY(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow ||
4242  pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow))
4243  {
4244  int iDelta = iOldRow - pThis->iRow;
4245 
4246  if((pThis->rctView.top - iDelta) > 0)
4247  {
4248  pThis->rctView.top -= iDelta;
4249  pThis->rctView.bottom -= iDelta;
4250  }
4251  else
4252  {
4253  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top;
4254  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4255  }
4256 
4257  if(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow) // still?
4258  {
4259  iDelta = pThis->rctView.top - pThis->iRow;
4260 
4261  pThis->rctView.bottom -= iDelta;
4262  pThis->rctView.top = pThis->iRow;
4263  }
4264  else if(pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow) // still?
4265  {
4266  iDelta = (pThis->iRow + 1) - pThis->rctView.bottom;
4267 
4268  pThis->rctView.top += iDelta;
4269  pThis->rctView.bottom = pThis->iRow + 1;
4270  }
4271  }
4272 
4273  // in this case, since I updated the position by an entire page, the entire window is probably invalid
4274 
4275  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
4276  }
4277

4382 static void __internal_page_left(struct _text_object_ *pThis)

4384 //int iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
