4399  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iPageWidth, pThis->iCol);
4400 
4401  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4402 
4403  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
4404 
4405  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4406 
4407  if(!pBuf)
4408  {
4409  pThis->iRow = 0;
4410  pThis->iCol = 0;
4411  }
4412  else if(pThis->iCol > iPageWidth)
4413  {
4414  pThis->iCol -= iPageWidth;
4415  }
4416  else
4417  {
4418  pThis->iCol = 0;
4419  }
4420 
4421  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
4422  {
4423  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4424  {
4425  pThis->rctSel.left = iOldCol;
4426  pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->iRow;
4427  }
4428 
4429  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
4430  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
4431  }
4432  else
4433  {
4434  // clear the selection if there is one
4435  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4436  {
4437  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
4438  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
4439  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
4440  }
4441  }
4442 
4443  if(WB_LIKELY(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol ||
4444  pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol))
4445  {
4446  int iDelta = pThis->iCol - iOldCol;
4447 
4448  if(pThis->rctView.left > iDelta)
4449  {
4450  pThis->rctView.left -= iDelta;
4451  pThis->rctView.right -= iDelta;
4452  }
4453  else
4454  {
4455  pThis->rctView.right = iPageWidth;
4456  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4457  }
4458 
4459  if(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol) // still?
4460  {
4461  iDelta = pThis->rctView.left - pThis->iCol;
4462 
4463  pThis->rctView.right -= iDelta;
4464  pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol;
4465  }
4466  else if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol) // still?
4467  {
4468  iDelta = (pThis->iCol + 1) - pThis->rctView.right;
4469 
4470  pThis->rctView.left += iDelta;
4471  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->iCol + 1;
4472  }
4473  }
4474 
4475  // in this case, since I updated the position by an entire page, the entire window is probably invalid
4476 
4477  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
4478  }
4479 }
4480 static void __internal_page_right(struct _text_object_ *pThis)

4575 static void __internal_cursor_home(struct _text_object_ *pThis)
4576 {
4577 const char *pL, *p2;
4578 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4579 
4580 
4581  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4582  {
4583  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4584  }
4585  else
4586  {
4587  int iOldCol = pThis->iCol;
4588 
4589  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4590 
4591  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 0); // invalidate current cursor rectangle
4592 
4593  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4594 
4595  if(!pBuf || pThis->iRow >= pBuf->nEntries || pThis->iCol > 0)
4596  {
4597  pThis->iCol = 0;
4598  }
4599  else
4600  {
4601  // find first non-white-space character and assign to THAT
4602  // TODO: handle hard tab translation? For now "leave it"
4603 
4604  pL = pBuf->aLines[pThis->iRow];
4605 
4606  if(pL)
4607  {
4608  p2 = pL;
4609  while(*p2 && *p2 <= ' ') // TODO: adjust for 'hard tab' char which might be 'U+00A0'...
4610  {
4611  p2++;
4612  }
4613 
4614  if(*p2)
4615  {
4616  pThis->iCol = (int)(p2 - pL); // toggling 'beginning of line' and column 0
4617  }
4618  }
4619  }
4620 
4621  if(pThis->iDragState & DragState_CURSOR)
4622  {
4623  if(SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4624  {
4625  pThis->rctSel.left = iOldCol;
4626  pThis->rctSel.top = pThis->iRow;
4627  }
4628 
4629  pThis->rctSel.right = pThis->iCol;
4630  pThis->rctSel.bottom = pThis->iRow;
4631  }
4632  else
4633  {
4634  // clear the selection if there is one
4635  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
4636  {
4637  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, &(pThis->rctHighLight), 0); // invalidate the highlight rectangle
4638  memset(&(pThis->rctSel), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctSel));
4639  memset(&(pThis->rctHighLight), 0, sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
4640  }
4641  }
4642 
4643  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
4644  {
4645  if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol ||
4646  pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
4647  {
4648  if(pThis->rctView.left > pThis->iCol)
4649  {
4650  pThis->rctView.right -= (pThis->rctView.left - pThis->iCol);
4651  pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol;
4652  }
4653  else if(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
4654  {
4655  pThis->rctView.left += pThis->iCol + 1 - pThis->rctView.right;
4656  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->iCol + 1;
4657  }
4658 
4659  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
4660 
4661  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
4662  }
4663  else // re-calculate cursor metrics
4664  {
4665  pThis->iCursorX += (pThis->iCol - iOldCol) * pThis->iFontWidth;
4666 
4667  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1); // invalidate the NEW cursor rectangle
4668  }
4669  }
4670  else
4671  {
4672  WB_WARN_PRINT("WARNING: %s line %d - invalidate entire window rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
4673 
4674  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here (confusion point)
4675  }
4676  }
4677 }

4897 static void __internal_scroll_vertical(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int nRows)
4898 {
4899 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4900 
4901  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4902  {
4903  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4904  }
4905  else
4906  {
4907 // int iOldRow WB_UNUSED = pThis->iRow; // TODO: do I still need this assignment? For now, mark 'unused' and leave for reference
4908 
4909  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_ScrollBar,
4910  "%s %d - scroll vertical by %d, iCol=%d\n",
4911  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, nRows, pThis->iCol);
4912 
4913  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4914 
4915  if(!nRows)
4916  {
4917  return; // do nothing
4918  }
4919 
4920  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4921 
4922  if(!pBuf)
4923  {
4924  pThis->iRow = 0;
4925  pThis->iCol = 0;
4926 
4927  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top; // assuming it's right
4928  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4929  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
4930  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4931  }
4932  else if(nRows < 0)
4933  {
4934  if(pThis->rctView.top + nRows < 0)
4935  {
4936  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top;
4937  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4938  }
4939  else
4940  {
4941  pThis->rctView.bottom += nRows;
4942  pThis->rctView.top += nRows;
4943  }
4944  }
4945  else // if(nRows > 0)
4946  {
4947  if(pThis->rctView.bottom + nRows > pBuf->nEntries)
4948  {
4949  pThis->rctView.top += pBuf->nEntries - pThis->rctView.bottom;
4950  pThis->rctView.bottom = pBuf->nEntries;
4951  }
4952  else
4953  {
4954  pThis->rctView.bottom += nRows;
4955  pThis->rctView.top += nRows;
4956  }
4957  }
4958 
4959  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
4960 
4961  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
4962  }
4963 }

4965 static void __internal_scroll_horizontal(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int nCols)
4966 {
4967 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf;
4968 
4969  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
4970  {
4971  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %p - invalid text object %p\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
4972  }
4973  else
4974  {
4975 // int iOldCol WB_UNUSED = pThis->iCol; // TODO: do I still need this assignment? For now, mark 'unused' and leave for reference
4976 
4977  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Heavy | DebugSubSystem_ScrollBar,
4978  "%s %d - scroll horizontal by %d, iCol=%d\n",
4979  __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, nCols, pThis->iCol);
4980 
4981  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_RESET; // this affects the cursor blink, basically resetting it whenever I edit something
4982 
4983  if(!nCols)
4984  {
4985  return; // do nothing
4986  }
4987 
4988  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
4989 
4990  if(!pBuf)
4991  {
4992  pThis->iRow = 0;
4993  pThis->iCol = 0;
4994 
4995  pThis->rctView.bottom -= pThis->rctView.top; // assuming it's right
4996  pThis->rctView.top = 0;
4997  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
4998  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
4999  }
5000  else if(pThis->iCol < 0)
5001  {
5002  pThis->iCol = 0; // always
5003 
5004  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
5005  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
5006  }
5007  else if(pThis->iCol + nCols > -INT_MAX && pThis->iCol + nCols < INT_MAX) // for now, ignore scroll on overflow
5008  {
5009  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // single line
5010  {
5011  if(pBuf->nEntries <= 0 || !pBuf->aLines[0])
5012  {
5013  pThis->iCol = 0;
5014 
5015  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left; // assuming it's right
5016  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
5017  }
5018  else
5019  {
5020  int iLen = WBGetMBLength(pBuf->aLines[0]);
5021 
5022  if(pThis->iRow != 0)
5023  {
5024  pThis->iRow = 0; // force it
5025  }
5026 
5027  // no 'virtual space' for single-line but trailing white space OK
5028  if(nCols > 0)
5029  {
5030  if(pThis->rctView.right + nCols > iLen + 1)
5031  {
5032  pThis->rctView.left += (iLen + 1 - nCols - pThis->rctView.right);
5033  pThis->rctView.right = iLen + 1;
5034  }
5035  else
5036  {
5037  pThis->rctView.left += nCols;
5038  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
5039  }
5040  }
5041  else
5042  {
5043  if(pThis->rctView.left + nCols < 0)
5044  {
5045  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left;
5046  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
5047  }
5048  else
5049  {
5050  pThis->rctView.left += nCols;
5051  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
5052  }
5053  }
5054  }
5055  }
5056  else
5057  {
5058  if(nCols > 0)
5059  {
5060  pThis->rctView.left += nCols; // scroll right always
5061  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
5062  }
5063  else
5064  {
5065  if(pThis->rctView.left + nCols < 0)
5066  {
5067  pThis->rctView.right -= pThis->rctView.left;
5068  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
5069  }
5070  else
5071  {
5072  pThis->rctView.left += nCols;
5073  pThis->rctView.right += nCols;
5074  }
5075  }
5076  }
5077  }
5078 
5079  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - need to optimize invalidate rect\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
5080 
5081  __internal_invalidate_rect(pThis, NULL, 1); // invalidate entire screen if I'm here
5082  }
5083 }

5161 static void __internal_do_expose(struct _text_object_ *pThis, Display *pDisplay, Window wID,
5162  WBGC gc, const WB_GEOM *pPaintGeom, const WB_GEOM *pViewGeom,
5163  WB_FONTC pFont)
5164 {
5165 TEXT_BUFFER *pBuf = NULL;
5166 WB_GEOM geomV, geomP, geomC;
5167 char *pL = NULL;
5168 int iXDelta, iYDelta;
5169 int i1, iLen, iFontHeight, iFontWidth, iAsc, iDesc, iX, iY, iPX, iPY;
5170 //int nFonts;
5171 //XFontSet fSet;
5172 Pixmap pxTemp;
5173 unsigned long clrFG, clrBG, clrHFG, clrHBG;
5174 WBGC gc2 = None;
5175 WB_RECT rctSel; // the NORMALIZED selection rectangle (calculated)
5176 int nEntries, iAutoScrollWidth, iWindowHeightInLines;
5177 
5178 
5179  if(!WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
5180  {
5181  WB_ERROR_PRINT("ERROR: %s - text object %p not valid\n", __FUNCTION__, pThis);
5182  return;
5183  }
5184 
5185  iXDelta = iYDelta = 0; // make sure, as they're used in a few places
5186 
5187  if(pViewGeom)
5188  {
5189  memcpy(&geomV, pViewGeom, sizeof(geomV));
5190  }
5191  else
5192  {
5193  WBGetWindowGeom(wID, &geomV);
5194 
5195  geomV.x = geomV.y = 0; // ALWAYS (make sure) - it's client coords now
5196 
5197  if(geomV.height <= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 4) // absolute minimum height
5198  {
5199  return; // can't do window that's way too small
5200  }
5201 
5202  geomV.y += MIN_BORDER_SPACING; // need a minimum top/bottom border as well
5203  geomV.height -= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 2;
5204  }
5205 
5206 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d window geometry: %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
5207 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, geomV.x, geomV.y, geomV.width, geomV.height);
5208 
5209  if(geomV.width <= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 4) // absolute minimum width
5210  {
5211  return; // can't do window that's way too small
5212  }
5213 
5214  // in all cases, make room on right/left edges for the cursor
5215 
5216  geomV.x += MIN_BORDER_SPACING; // required for cursor
5217  geomV.width -= MIN_BORDER_SPACING * 2;
5218 
5219  // TODO: make use of geomV's "border" parameter??
5220 
5221  if(pPaintGeom)
5222  {
5223  memcpy(&geomP, pPaintGeom, sizeof(geomP));
5224  }
5225  else
5226  {
5227  memcpy(&geomP, &geomV, sizeof(geomP));
5228  }
5229 
5230 // fSet = __internal_verify_get_fontset(pDisplay, rFontSet, gc);
5231 // // NOTE: at this point I must use 'fSet' to do all of the font metrics + drawing
5232 //
5233 //
5234 // // NOTE: to find the floor of the font, I'll need to determine max iAsc and iDesc
5235 // // this next function call tells me how many fonts I have, and determines the
5236 // // max ascent and descent and stores that in iAsc and iDesc
5237 // nFonts = __internal_get_fontset_count_and_max_asc_desc(fSet, &iAsc, &iDesc);
5238 
5239  iAsc = 0;
5240  iDesc = 0;
5241 
5242  if(!pFont)
5243  {
5244  // TODO: optimize this with cached information so it goes faster, and have
5245  // some 'font query' APIs for the GC as well
5246 
5247  pFont = WBQueryGCFont(gc); // TODO: optimize this
5248 
5249  if(!pFont)
5250  {
5251  pFont = WBGetDefaultFont();
5252  }
5253  }
5254 
5255  if(pFont)
5256  {
5257  iAsc = WBFontAscent(pFont);
5258  iDesc = WBFontDescent(pFont);
5259 
5260 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d font ascent=%d, descent=%d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iAsc, iDesc);
5261  }
5262  else
5263  {
5264  WB_ERROR_PRINT("%s - ERROR: no fonts!\n", __FUNCTION__);
5265 
5266  goto the_end;
5267  }
5268 
5269  // TODO: XFontStruct::direction indicates LTR RTL TTB or BTT for painting - for now _ONLY_ LTR_TTB will apply
5270 
5271 
5272  // NOW get the font width for a space (TODO: average char width instead?)
5273  iFontWidth = WBTextWidth(pFont, " ", 1); // WB_TEXT_ESCAPEMENT(fSet, " ", 1);
5274 
5275 #warning support proportional pitch fonts by assigning a font width < 0 ??? For now only fixed-pitch are supported by this object
5276 
5277  // get FG/BG color information
5278  clrFG = WBGetGCFGColor(gc);
5279  clrBG = WBGetGCBGColor(gc);
5280 
5281  // TODO: compare clrHFG and clrHBG to a "NULL" XColor?
5282  if(!(pThis->clrHFG.flags & (DoRed | DoGreen | DoBlue)) &&
5283  !(pThis->clrHFG.flags & (DoRed | DoGreen | DoBlue))) // the colors have not been assigned
5284  {
5285  clrHBG = clrFG;
5286  clrHFG = clrBG;
5287  }
5288  else
5289  {
5290  clrHBG = pThis->clrHBG.pixel;
5291  clrHFG = pThis->clrHFG.pixel;
5292  }
5293 
5294  // make a copy of the WBGC since I'm probably going to mess with it
5295 
5296  gc2 = WBCreateGC(pDisplay, wID, 0, NULL);
5297 
5298  if(gc2 != None)
5299  {
5300  if(!WBCopyGC2(gc, GCAll, gc2))
5301  {
5302  WBFreeGC(gc2);
5303  gc2 = None;
5304  }
5305  }
5306 
5307  // font metrics complete. Now THAT wasn't so bad, was it? OK it was but only need to do it here
5308 
5309  // cache the owner window ID
5310  pThis->wIDOwner = wID;
5311 
5312  // cache the font metrics
5313  pThis->iAsc = iAsc;
5314  pThis->iDesc = iDesc;
5315  pThis->iFontWidth = iFontWidth;
5316 
5317 #warning support proportional pitch fonts by assigning a font width < 0 ??? For now only fixed-pitch are supported by this object
5318 
5319  // keep track of the total viewport in window coordinates.
5320  // this will be used later for mouse translation
5321 
5322  pThis->rctWinView.left = geomV.x;
5323  pThis->rctWinView.top = geomV.y;
5324  pThis->rctWinView.right = pThis->rctWinView.left + geomV.width;
5325  pThis->rctWinView.bottom = pThis->rctWinView.top + geomV.height;
5326 
5327  // cache the pointer to the TEXT BUFFER
5328  pBuf = (TEXT_BUFFER *)(pThis->pText);
5329 
5330  // NOTE: in the next sections, deal with NULL pBuf by cacheing 'nEntries'
5331 
5332  if(!pBuf || pBuf->nEntries <= 0) // also test for this condition and treat it as single-line also (temporary)
5333  {
5334  nEntries = 0;
5335  }
5336  else
5337  {
5338  nEntries = pBuf->nEntries;
5339  }
5340 
5341 
5342  // ------------------------------------------
5343  // CALCULATING THE CORRECT VIEWPORT (rctView)
5344  // ------------------------------------------
5345  //
5346  // NOTE: if the owning window has reset the viewport, the entire window SHOULD
5347  // be invalid. If not, it won't paint properly.
5348 
5349  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // SINGLE LINE
5350  {
5351 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d single line text object expose\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
5352 
5353  // AUTO-ASSIGN the viewport whenever right <= left (i.e. viewport is 'NULL' or 'empty')
5354  // or whenever the viewport is not properly assigned (window re-size re-paint)
5355 
5356  iFontHeight = iAsc + iDesc; // does not include interline spacing (that comes later for multi-line only)
5357 
5358 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d font height=%d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iFontHeight);
5359 
5360  if(pThis->rctView.top || pThis->rctView.bottom ||
5361  pThis->rctView.right != pThis->rctView.left + geomV.width / iFontWidth) // not PROPERLY assigned
5362  {
5363  iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
5364 
5365  if(pThis->rctView.left < 0) // not already assigned
5366  {
5367  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
5368  }
5369 
5370  pThis->rctView.top = pThis->rctView.bottom = 0; // single line forces this (always)
5371 
5372  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left + geomV.width / iFontWidth;
5373 
5374  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left)
5375  {
5376  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
5377  {
5378  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
5379  }
5380 
5381  // scroll right to expose the cursor
5382 
5383  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
5384  {
5385  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
5386  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
5387  }
5388  }
5389  else
5390  {
5391  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol; // desperate to have something there
5392  }
5393  }
5394  }
5395  else // MULTI-LINE
5396  {
5397 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d multi-line text object expose\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
5398 
5399  // adjust font height to include line spacing (I'll use this to position the lines)
5400 
5401  iFontHeight = WBTextObjectCalculateLineHeight(pThis->iAsc, pThis->iDesc);
5402 
5403  iWindowHeightInLines = geomV.height / iFontHeight; // window height (in lines)
5404  if(!iWindowHeightInLines)
5405  {
5406  iWindowHeightInLines = 1; // just in case so I don't divide by zero
5407  }
5408 
5409  // AUTO-ASSIGN the viewport whenever right <= left (i.e. viewport is 'NULL' or 'empty')
5410  // or whenever the viewport is not properly assigned (window re-size re-paint)
5411 
5412  if(pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left
5413  != geomV.width / iFontWidth // viewport needs re-calculation
5414  || pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top
5415  != iWindowHeightInLines // viewport needs re-calculation
5416  || pThis->rctView.top > nEntries) // top exceeds total # of lines
5417  {
5418  iAutoScrollWidth = AUTO_HSCROLL_SIZE;
5419 
5420  if(pThis->rctView.left < 0) // not already assigned
5421  {
5422  pThis->rctView.left = 0;
5423  }
5424 
5425  if(pThis->rctView.top < 0 || pThis->rctView.top > nEntries
5426  || (pThis->rctView.top && nEntries < iWindowHeightInLines))
5427  {
5428  pThis->rctView.top = 0; // set viewport to top
5429  }
5430 
5431  if(pThis->rctView.bottom - pThis->rctView.top
5432  != iWindowHeightInLines)
5433  {
5434  pThis->rctView.bottom = pThis->rctView.top + iWindowHeightInLines;
5435 
5436  // always scroll row into view
5437 
5438  while(pThis->rctView.top > pThis->iRow)
5439  {
5440  pThis->rctView.top -= iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
5441  pThis->rctView.bottom -= iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
5442  }
5443  while(pThis->rctView.bottom <= pThis->iRow)
5444  {
5445  pThis->rctView.top += iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
5446  pThis->rctView.bottom += iWindowHeightInLines - 1;
5447  }
5448  }
5449 
5450  if(pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left != geomV.width / iFontWidth)
5451  {
5452  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left + geomV.width / iFontWidth;
5453 
5454  if(pThis->rctView.right > pThis->rctView.left) // just in case, test it
5455  {
5456  while(iAutoScrollWidth > 1 && iAutoScrollWidth >= pThis->rctView.right - pThis->rctView.left)
5457  {
5458  iAutoScrollWidth >>= 1;
5459  }
5460 
5461  // scroll right to expose the cursor
5462 
5463  while(pThis->rctView.right <= pThis->iCol)
5464  {
5465  pThis->rctView.left += iAutoScrollWidth;
5466  pThis->rctView.right += iAutoScrollWidth;
5467  }
5468  }
5469  else
5470  {
5471  pThis->rctView.right = pThis->rctView.left = pThis->iCol; // desperate to have something there
5472  }
5473  }
5474  }
5475  }
5476 
5477 
5478  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
5479  // convert the highlight rectangle into screen coordinates (fills in rctSel)
5480  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
5481 
5482  if(!SEL_RECT_EMPTY(pThis))
5483  {
5484  if(SEL_RECT_ALL(pThis))
5485  {
5486  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctView), sizeof(rctSel)); // use entire viewport for hightlight rect
5487  // TODO: single-line, only select to end of string?
5488 
5489 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d select rect is 'select all' - font height %d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iFontHeight);
5490  }
5491  else
5492  {
5493  memcpy(&rctSel, &(pThis->rctSel), sizeof(rctSel));
5494  NORMALIZE_SEL_RECT(rctSel);
5495 
5496 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d select rectangle not empty - font height %d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iFontHeight);
5497  }
5498 
5499  pThis->rctHighLight.left = pThis->rctWinView.left
5500  + (rctSel.left - pThis->rctView.left) * iFontWidth;
5501 
5502  pThis->rctHighLight.top = pThis->rctWinView.top
5503  + (rctSel.top - pThis->rctView.top) * iFontHeight;
5504 
5505  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE)
5506  {
5507  if(geomV.height >= iAsc + iDesc)
5508  pThis->rctHighLight.top += (geomV.height - (iAsc + iDesc)) / 2; // since single-line text is centered
5509  }
5510 
5511  pThis->rctHighLight.right = pThis->rctHighLight.left
5512  + (rctSel.right - rctSel.left) * iFontWidth;
5513 
5514  pThis->rctHighLight.bottom = pThis->rctHighLight.top // NOTE add 1 to # of lines, always
5515  + (rctSel.bottom - rctSel.top + 1) * iFontHeight;
5516 
5517  // NOTE: this is independent of the selection method. In the special case
5518  // that a single line or an entire line is selected, I may have
5519  // to handle this differently
5520 
5521 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d select rect: %d, %d, %d, %d of %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
5522 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
5523 // rctSel.left, rctSel.top, rctSel.right, rctSel.bottom,
5524 // pThis->rctView.left, pThis->rctView.top, pThis->rctView.right, pThis->rctView.bottom);
5525 //
5526 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d highlight rect: %d, %d, %d, %d of %d, %d, %d, %d\n",
5527 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__,
5528 // pThis->rctHighLight.left, pThis->rctHighLight.top, pThis->rctHighLight.right, pThis->rctHighLight.bottom,
5529 // pThis->rctWinView.left, pThis->rctWinView.top, pThis->rctWinView.right, pThis->rctWinView.bottom);
5530 
5531 
5532 
5533 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d geomV.height = %d FG/BG colors %08lxH %08lxH %08lxH %08lxH\n",
5534 // __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, geomV.height,
5535 // (unsigned long)clrFG, (unsigned long)clrBG, (unsigned long)clrHFG, (unsigned long)clrHBG);
5536  }
5537  else
5538  {
5539  bzero(&rctSel, sizeof(rctSel)); // zero out selection rectangle
5540  bzero(&(pThis->rctHighLight), sizeof(pThis->rctHighLight));
5541 
5542 // WB_ERROR_PRINT("TEMPORARY: %s.%d select rectangle *EMPTY*\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
5543  }
5544 
5545 
5546  //--------------------------------------------
5547  // CREATE PIXMAP (for speeding up the process)
5548  //--------------------------------------------
5549 
5550  iPX = pThis->rctWinView.right - pThis->rctWinView.left + 2 * MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
5551  iPY = pThis->rctWinView.bottom - pThis->rctWinView.top + 2 * MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
5552 
5553 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s window %u (%08xH) pixmap dimensions %d,%d\n"
5554 // " row/col %d,%d\n",
5555 // __FUNCTION__, (int)wID, (int)wID, iPX, iPY,
5556 // pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol);
5557 
5558  if(gc2 != None && iPX > 0 && iPY > 0)
5559  {
5560  pxTemp = XCreatePixmap(pDisplay, wID, iPX, iPY,
5561  DefaultDepth(pDisplay, DefaultScreen(pDisplay)));
5562  }
5563  else
5564  {
5565  pxTemp = None;
5566  }
5567 
5568  //-----------------------
5569  // FILL/ERASE BACKGROUND
5570  //-----------------------
5571 
5572  if(pxTemp != None)
5573  {
5574  iXDelta = geomV.x - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
5575  iYDelta = geomV.y - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
5576 
5577  // sometimes the clipping origin, when filling the background, might matter, especially if patterns are involved
5578  WBSetClipOrigin(gc2, -iXDelta, -iYDelta); // so that it matches the display's clipping in gc
5579 
5580  WBSetForeground(gc2, clrBG);
5581  WBFillRectangle(pDisplay, pxTemp, gc2, 0, 0, iPX, iPY);
5582 
5583  WBSetForeground(gc2, clrFG);
5584  }
5585  else // FALLBACK, if no pixmap, go to window directly
5586  {
5587  iXDelta = 0;
5588  iYDelta = 0; // make sure, as they're used in a few places
5589 
5590  WBSetForeground(gc, clrBG);
5591  WBFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc,
5592  pThis->rctWinView.left,
5593  pThis->rctWinView.top,
5594  pThis->rctWinView.right - pThis->rctWinView.left,
5595  pThis->rctWinView.bottom - pThis->rctWinView.top);
5596 
5597  WBSetForeground(gc, clrFG);
5598  }
5599 
5600 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s line %d - iXDelta is %d, iYDelta is %d\n", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iXDelta, iYDelta);
5601 
5602  // At this point, if pBuf is NULL or the # of entries zero, the background is *STILL* erased
5603  // and the cursor has to be drawn.
5604 
5605 // if(!pBuf || pBuf->nEntries <= 0)
5606 // {
5608 // goto almost_the_end; // I use the goto so I can put cleanup code there - it's safer
5609 // }
5610 
5611 
5612  // if it's a single-line object, center it within the window and display only ONE line
5613 
5614  if(pThis->iLineFeed == LineFeed_NONE) // i.e. SINGLE LINE
5615  {
5617  // SINGLE LINE PAINTING
5619 
5620  iY = geomV.height - iFontHeight;
5621  if(iY < 0) // when this happens it screws the calculation up
5622  {
5623  iY = 0;
5624  }
5625

5627

5629  iX = geomV.x;
5630 
5631  if(pBuf)
5632  {
5633  pL = pBuf->aLines[0];
5634  }
5635  else
5636  {
5637  pL= NULL;
5638  }
5639 
5640 // if(!pL)
5641 // {
5642 // goto the_end;
5643 // }
5644

5647  // DRAWING HIGHLIGHT RECTANGLE
5648  //-----------------------------
5649 
5650  if(pThis->rctHighLight.right > pThis->rctHighLight.left &&
5651  WBRectOverlapped(pThis->rctHighLight, pThis->rctWinView))

5680  }

5804

5862

5866  }
5867  else

5870  }
5871

5874  iCurRow < pThis->rctSel.bottom) ||
5875  (iCurRow == pThis->rctSel.top &&

5879  {

5881 
5882  // fill the rectangle for this character with the correct background color.
5883

5885  {

5894  }
5895  else // FALLBACK, if no pixmap, go to window directly

5898  WBSetBackground(gc, clrHBG);
5899 
5900  WBFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc,
5901  iX, iY0,
5902  iFontWidth, iFontHeight);
5903 
5904  WBSetForeground(gc, clrHFG);
5905  }
5906  }

5908  {
5909  WBSetForeground(gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrFG);
5910  WBSetBackground(gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrBG);
5911  }

5916  //------------

5923  {

5935

5937 // iX, iY, iAsc, iDesc, iXDelta, iYDelta,

5963  }

5967 // __FUNCTION__, pThis->iRow, pThis->iCol, iCurRow, i1);
5968 // }

5983

5996 
5997  WBSetForeground(gc2, clrHFG);
5998  }
5999  else // FALLBACK, if no pixmap, go to window directly
6000  {
6001  WBSetForeground(gc, clrHBG); // highlight background color
6002  WBSetBackground(gc, clrHBG);
6003 
6004  WBFillRectangle(pDisplay, wID, gc,
6005  iX, iY0,
6006  geomV.width, iFontHeight); // entire line
6007 
6008  WBSetForeground(gc, clrHFG);
6009  }
6010  }
6011  else
6012  {

6014  WBSetBackground(gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc, clrBG);
6015  }

6018  {
6019  DTDrawString(pDisplay, pxTemp ? pxTemp : wID, pFont,
6020  gc2 != None ? gc2 : gc,
6021  iX - iXDelta, iY - iYDelta,
6022  p1, p2 - p1);
6023  }
6024 // else (this happens when lines are blank)
6025 // {
6026 // WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s - NOT drawing \"%s\"\n p1=%p p2=%p delta=%d\n",
6027 // __FUNCTION__, pL, p1, p2, (int)(p2 - p1));
6028 // }
6029  }
6030  }
6031  }

6034  // PIXMAP OPTIMIZATION - TRANSFER TO WINDOW
6035  //------------------------------------------
6036 
6037 //almost_the_end:
6038 
6039  if(pxTemp != None) // OPTIMIZATION (using pixmap)
6040  {
6041  int iX0=0, iY0=0, iW0=iPX, iH0=iPY;
6042 
6043  iX = pThis->rctWinView.left - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
6044  iY = pThis->rctWinView.top - MIN_BORDER_SPACING;
6045 
6046  // only copy the invalid area (this should save some time)
6047 
6048  if(geomP.x > iX)
6049  {
6050  iX0 = geomP.x - iX;
6051  iW0 -= iX0;
6052  iX = geomP.x;
6053  }
6054 
6055  if(geomP.x + geomP.width < iX + iW0)
6056  {
6057  iW0 = geomP.x + geomP.width - iX;
6058  }
6059 
6060  if(geomP.y > iY)
6061  {
6062  iY0 = geomP.y - iY;
6063  iH0 -= iY0;
6064  iY = geomP.y;
6065  }
6066 
6067  if(geomP.y + geomP.height < iY + iH0)
6068  {
6069  iH0 = geomP.y + geomP.height - iY;
6070  }
6071 
6072  if(iH0 > 0 && iW0 > 0)
6073  {
6074  XCopyArea(pDisplay, pxTemp, wID, gc->gc, // this time use GC to do the copy
6075  iX0, iY0, iW0, iH0, iX, iY);
6076  }
6077 
6078  XFreePixmap(pDisplay, pxTemp);
6079  }
6080 
6081 
6082 the_end:
6083 
6084  // mandatory resource free-up goes here, hence the 'goto' label
6085 
6086  if(gc2 != None)
6087  {
6088  WBFreeGC(gc2);
6089  }
6090 }

6092 static int __internal_cursor_show(int iBlinkState) // determines if blink state shows the cursor
6093 {
6094  return iBlinkState != CURSOR_BLINK_OFF ? 1 : 0;
6095 }
6096 
6097 static void __internal_cursor_blink(struct _text_object_ *pThis, int bHasFocus)
6098 {
6099  if(WBIsValidTextObject(pThis))
6100  {
6101  int bShow = __internal_cursor_show(pThis->iBlinkState);
6102 
6103  if(!bHasFocus)
6104  {
6105  if(pThis->iBlinkState != CURSOR_BLINK_OFF)
6106  {
6107  pThis->iBlinkState = CURSOR_BLINK_OFF; // no cursor
6108 
6109  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, 1);
6110  }
6111  }
6112  else
6113  {
6114  pThis->iBlinkState = (pThis->iBlinkState + 1) % CURSOR_BLINK_PERIOD;
6115 
6116  __internal_invalidate_cursor(pThis, bShow != __internal_cursor_show(pThis->iBlinkState));
6117  //pThis->iBlinkState == 0 || pThis->iBlinkState == 1);
6118  }
6119  }
6120 }

6139 // ----------------------------
6140 // MBCS UTF-8 UTILITY FUNCTIONS
6141 // ----------------------------
6142 
6143 // see RFC3629 and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8#Codepage_layout
6144 
6145 static int internal_IsMBCharValid(const char *pChar, int *piLen)
6146 {
6147 const unsigned char *p1;
6148 int iRval;
6149 
6150 
6151  if((unsigned char)*pChar < 0x80) // normal ASCII (including '0' byte)
6152  {
6153  if(piLen)
6154  {
6155  if(*pChar)
6156  {
6157  *piLen = 1;
6158  }
6159  else
6160  {
6161  *piLen = 0;
6162  }
6163  }
6164 
6165  return 1; // valid char
6166  }
6167 
6168  p1 = (const unsigned char *)pChar;
6169  iRval = 0; // initially, call it 'invalid'
6170 
6171  // 80-BF - values 0-3F 'continuation' bytes for mbcs [sequence will not start with this]
6172  // C0-DF - 2-byte character
6173  // (C0=0, C1=40H, C2=80H, up to 7C0H for DF; values C0 and C1 are actually 'not valid' as it's pointless)
6174  // E0-EF - 3-byte character
6175  // (E0 adds 800H; E1 adds 1000H; E2 2000H; etc. up to F000H for EF. not all E0 sequences are valid)
6176  // F0-FF - 4+byte character
6177  // (F0 is 10000H; F1 40000H; F2 80000H; F3 C0000H; F4 100000H; values F5 and above are 'not valid'
6178  // Not all F0's are valid, either)
6179  //
6180  // For invalid sequences, this function will attempt to work around it; however RFC3629 requires them to be error conditions
6181  // to avoid security-related problems caused by invalid UTF8 sequences.
6182 
6183  if(*p1 < 0xc2 || // a continuation character? an 'invalid' sequence?
6184  *p1 >= 0xf5) // assume value cannot be > 0xff, right?
6185  {
6186  p1++; // invalid; length is 1 (like ASCII)
6187  }
6188  else if(*p1 < 0xe0) // 2-byte sequence
6189  {
6190  if((unsigned char)p1[1] >= 0x80 && (unsigned char)p1[1] <= 0xbf) // valid 2-byte sequence
6191  {
6192  p1 += 2;
6193  iRval = 1;
6194  }
6195  else
6196  {
6197  p1++; // invalid; length is 1 (like ASCII)
6198  }
6199  }
6200  else if(*p1 < 0xf0) // 3-byte sequence
6201  {
6202  if(p1[1] >= 0x80 && p1[1] <= 0xbf && // valid 3-byte sequence
6203  p1[2] >= 0x80 && p1[2] <= 0xbf)
6204  {
6205  // TODO: validate E0 sequences
6206 
6207  p1 += 3;
6208  iRval = 1;
6209  }
6210  else // now it gets trickier...
6211  {
6212  // by convention, treat it like 8-bit ASCII with a length of 1
6213  p1++;
6214  }
6215  }
6216  else // if(*p1 < 0xf5)
6217  {
6218  if(p1[1] >= 0x80 && p1[1] <= 0xbf && // valid 4-byte sequence
6219  p1[2] >= 0x80 && p1[2] <= 0xbf &&
6220  p1[3] >= 0x80 && p1[3] <= 0xbf)
6221  {
6222  // TODO: validate F0 sequences
6223 
6224  p1 += 4;
6225  iRval = 1;
6226  }
6227  else // now it gets trickier...
6228  {
6229  // by convention, treat it like 8-bit ASCII with a length of 1
6230  p1++;
6231  }
6232  }
6233 
6234  if(piLen)
6235  {
6236  *piLen = (const char *)p1 - pChar; // this simplified length indicator helps with copy/pasta [if I need it]
6237  }
6238 
6239 #ifndef NO_DEBUG
6240  if(!iRval || ((const char *)p1 - pChar) > 1)
6241  {
6242  int iLen = ((const char *)p1 - pChar);
6243 
6244  WB_DEBUG_PRINT(DebugLevel_Verbose, "%s.%d - return=%d char=%02xH", __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, iRval, (unsigned char)*pChar);
6245  while(iLen > 1)
6246  {
6247  iLen--;
6248  pChar++;
6249 
6250  WBDebugPrint(",%02xH", (unsigned char)*pChar);
6251  }
6252  WBDebugPrint("\n");
6253  }
6254 #endif // NO_DEBUG
6255 
6256  return iRval;
6257 }

6259 static int internal_MBstrlen(const char *pString)
6260 {
6261 const char *p1 = pString;
6262 int iLen, iRval;
6263 
6264 
6265  iRval = 0;
6266 
6267  while(*p1)
6268  {
6269  // step through 1 character at a time until I reach the end of the string, or iCol reaches zero
6270 
6271  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &iLen))
6272  {
6273  p1++; // treat like 8-bit ASCII if it's an invalid UTF-8 sequence
6274 
6275  // NOTE: may change or render as EF BF BD i.e. U+FFFD (a diamond with question mark)
6276  }
6277  else
6278  {
6279  p1 += iLen;
6280  }
6281 
6282  iRval++; // we only count blue cars (and multi-byte chars as "1")
6283  }
6284 
6285  return iRval;
6286 }

6288 // return the 'character' index for the 'column' specified by 'iCol' for MBCS
6289 
6290 static int internal_MBColIndex(const char *pString, int iCol)
6291 {
6292 const char *p1 = pString;
6293 int iLen;
6294 
6295 
6296  while(iCol > 0 && *p1)
6297  {
6298  // step through 1 character at a time until I reach the end of the string, or iCol reaches zero
6299 
6300  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &iLen))
6301  {
6302  p1++; // treat like 8-bit ASCII if it's an invalid UTF-8 sequence
6303 
6304  // NOTE: may change or render as EF BF BD i.e. U+FFFD (a diamond with question mark)
6305  }
6306  else
6307  {
6308  p1 += iLen;
6309  }
6310 
6311  iCol--;
6312  }
6313 
6314  return (p1 - pString); // NOTE: need to verify length before calling or this could be WRONG
6315 }

6338 char * WBSplitMBLine(char *pString, int iCol)
6339 {
6340 char *p1, *pRval;
6341 int iLen, i1;
6342 
6343 
6344  iLen = internal_MBstrlen(pString);
6345 
6346  if(iCol >= iLen) // past end of string?
6347  {
6348  pRval = WBCopyString(""); // allocated pointer that's a copy of an empty string - it's what I'll start with
6349  }
6350  else
6351  {
6352  i1 = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol);
6353 
6354  pRval = WBCopyString(pString + i1);
6355 
6356  if(pRval)
6357  {
6358  pString[i1] = 0; // terminate it here (my 'split')
6359  }
6360  }
6361 
6362  if(pRval) // if I have a valid return, right-trim the original line
6363  {
6364  p1 = pString + strlen(pString);
6365 
6366  while(p1 > pString && *(p1 - 1) <= ' ') // right-trim it
6367  {
6368  *(--p1) = 0; // right-trim the string - make ALL white space GO AWAY
6369  }
6370  }
6371 
6372  return(pRval);
6373 }

6375 char * WBJoinMBLine(char *pString, int iCol, const char *pJoin)
6376 {
6377 int iLen, iLenNew, iJoin;
6378 char *pRval, *p1;
6379 
6380 
6381  iLen = internal_MBstrlen(pString);
6382  if(iLen < iCol)
6383  {
6384  iLenNew = iCol;
6385  }
6386  else
6387  {
6388  iLenNew = iLen;
6389  }
6390 
6391  iJoin = internal_MBstrlen(pJoin);
6392 
6393  pRval = WBReAlloc(pString, iLenNew + iJoin + 2);
6394  if(!pRval)
6395  {
6396  return NULL;
6397  }
6398 
6399  p1 = pRval + strlen(pRval); // regardless of actual length, this works
6400 
6401  while(iLen < iLenNew)
6402  {
6403  *(p1++) = ' '; // add white space up to 'iCol'
6404  iLen++;
6405  }
6406 
6407  strcpy(p1, pJoin);
6408 
6409  return pRval;
6410 }

6412 int WBDelMBChars(char *pString, int iCol, int nDel, int *piNewCol, char **ppDeleted)
6413 {
6414 int iLen, iIndex, i1, iRval = nDel;
6415 char *pDelChar, *p1;
6416 
6417 
6418  if(ppDeleted)
6419  {
6420  *ppDeleted = NULL; // initial value
6421  }
6422 
6423  if(piNewCol)
6424  {
6425  *piNewCol = iCol; // initial value
6426  }
6427 
6428  if(!pString || !nDel || !*pString)
6429  {
6430  if(piNewCol)
6431  {
6432  *piNewCol = iCol; // for now, just do this, even if string is blank
6433  }
6434 
6435  return nDel; // parameter validation
6436  }
6437 
6438  iLen = internal_MBstrlen(pString);
6439 
6440  if(iRval > 0)
6441  {
6442  if(ppDeleted && iLen > iCol)
6443  {
6444  pDelChar = WBAlloc(4 // max size of MB char
6445  * (iLen - iCol + 1) // 1 more than # of chars to delete
6446  + 1); // additional storage for zero byte
6447 
6448  *ppDeleted = pDelChar; // NOTE: caller checks for NULL to determine error state
6449 
6450  if(pDelChar)
6451  {
6452  *pDelChar = 0; // make sure
6453  }
6454  }
6455  else
6456  {
6457  pDelChar = NULL;
6458  }
6459 
6460  while(iLen > iCol && iRval > 0)
6461  {
6462  iIndex = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol);
6463 
6464  p1 = pString + iIndex; // always
6465 
6466  if(!*p1)
6467  {
6468  break; // I'm at the end of the string (sanity test)
6469  }
6470 
6471  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &i1))
6472  {
6473  // invalid character - truncate the line here!
6474 
6475  *p1 = 0;
6476  iRval = 0; // assume 'end of line' and terminate deleting
6477 
6478  break;
6479  }
6480 
6481  if(pDelChar && i1 > 0)
6482  {
6483  memcpy(pDelChar, p1, i1);
6484  pDelChar += i1;
6485 
6486  *pDelChar = 0; // mark the end of the string
6487  }
6488 
6489  iRval --; // deleting one character (so remove a 'delete')
6490  iLen--; // update the new length
6491 
6492  // i1 is the length of the next character. slide 'em down! [this is less efficient, but more 'stable']
6493  strcpy(p1, p1 + i1); // simplest method
6494  }
6495  }
6496  else
6497  {
6498  if(ppDeleted && iCol > 0)
6499  {
6500  pDelChar = WBAlloc(4 // max size of MB char
6501  * (iCol + 1) // 1 more than # of chars to delete
6502  + 1); // additional storage for zero byte
6503 
6504  *ppDeleted = pDelChar; // NOTE: caller checks for NULL to determine error state
6505 
6506  if(pDelChar)
6507  {
6508  *pDelChar = 0; // make sure
6509  }
6510  }
6511  else
6512  {
6513  pDelChar = NULL;
6514  }
6515 
6516  // NOW we do backspacing, which preserves the character at 'iCol'. this is a little trickier.
6517  // when we end up at column zero, we return the 'iRval' count.
6518 
6519  while(iCol > 0 && iRval < 0)
6520  {
6521  if(iCol <= iLen) // I'm NOT past the end
6522  {
6523  iIndex = internal_MBColIndex(pString, iCol - 1); // PREVIOUS column
6524 
6525  p1 = pString + iIndex; // always
6526 
6527  if(!*p1)
6528  {
6529  break; // I'm at the end of the string (sanity test, unlikely to happen)
6530  }
6531 
6532  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &i1))
6533  {
6534  // invalid character - truncate the line here!
6535 
6536  *p1 = 0;
6537  iRval = 0; // assume 'end of line' at this point, and terminate deleting
6538 
6539  break;
6540  }
6541 
6542  if(pDelChar && i1 > 0)
6543  {
6544  // insert this character into the beginning of the 'undo' info string
6545  // there are probably BETTER ways to do this, but this is what I'll do.
6546 
6547  memmove(pDelChar + i1, pDelChar, strlen(pDelChar) + 1); // open up space. make sure ending zero byte is included.
6548  memcpy(pDelChar, p1, i1);
6549  }
6550 
6551  // i1 is the length of the prev character, so slide 'em down! [this is less efficient, but more 'stable']
6552  strcpy(p1, p1 + i1); // simplest method (I could also get the pointer to the 'iCol'th char, but this is more consistent)
6553  }
6554  else
6555  {
6556  // since I'm at the end, just delete the last char in the line (effectively) by decrementing the column
6557  // so nothing else to do here other than the end of the loop
6558  }
6559 
6560  iCol--;
6561  iRval++; // because it's NEGATIVE, so we increment it
6562  }
6563  }
6564 
6565  // it seems in both cases (above) this section remains exactly the same
6566  // how amazing that works out!
6567 
6568  if(piNewCol)
6569  {
6570  *piNewCol = iCol; // 'iCol' will be the NEW column for the cursor
6571  }
6572 
6573  return iRval;
6574 }
6575 
6576 int WBGetMBLength(const char *pString)
6577 {
6578  if(!pString)
6579  {
6580  return 0;
6581  }
6582 
6583  return internal_MBstrlen(pString);
6584 }

6603  }

6634 
6635  if(!internal_IsMBCharValid(p1, &iLen))
6636  {

6640  }
6641  else

6647  }

6650  {
